9ataDvHBKaElfIUJngDWng.text: I enjoy making and watching other people trying to stack pounds of stuff on the bowls trying to get their moneys worth:) the food is always good and service is pretty smooth. the first two times the messed up my rice but were quick to offer to fix it.

ZcRxxMWrOnK6SPDOfakP5A.text: This is my fourth time back with my husband and kids and I must say that every visit has been such a pleasure. Our server Taylor is the reason we keep returning. The food speaks for itself great taste great quality but your dining experience relies on the customer service. When your waiter or waitress not only knows you by name but can remember what you like to eat and what appetizers you previously tried that is what going above and beyond stands for. I love the dining experience and atmosphere . Tonight I got to enjoy football great prices and felt like I was fine dining . I truly hope someone recognizes when your staff goes above and beyond excellence to ensure the customers are given a great dining experience . From the attentiveness to the hot meal you created this place feels like home. Just an fyi I did read a previous statement by a customers complaining about Taylor and I beg to differ.. If the staff asks if you have been there before it's because they want to ensure that your experience will be a memorable one. When your waiter asks if everything is alright or do you enjoy the food it's because they really want your opinion to make sure you are enjoying what you are paying for . Seems to me like this girl should have stayed home . Overall u get your money's worth your kids are entertained with the games a great place to take your family for a healty dinner .. Please ask for Taylor to serve you she will bring a smile to your face

El1qcXXd2rkWzNn12XvCKg.text: I have been to Genghis Grill a few times already and I really like this place, I always tell my friends about it too. This place is good, but it should be great. The concept is easy.. You build your own bowl with your choice of protein, veggies, sauce/seasonings and starches. My bowls always taste really good so as far as that it's perfect. What I'm not 100% on is the service. The staff is always very nice, but I feel like I am being suffocated by them. When you are first seated you wait for your server to come and I feel like they just talk sooo much and explain what I already know, this bugs since they ask if you know how the build your own bowl works. I feel they need more choices for appetizers, specially since they have 120 drink choices. The food line always looks like a mess.. I understand it's self serve, but that's why it should be kept cleaner. There's plenty of ingredient choices so every time you go there you can make a totally different bowl. Once you complete your bowl it only takes a few minutes for it to be cooked. I like that they are done quick, I just don't like that the bowls are not brought out together. I hate eating before everyone has their food and I had to wait a couple of minutes before I could have a bite since we were missing one bowl. I do believe all the plates should be brought out together. On this last visit out service visited our table about 4 times.. I feel that's a bit much since she wasn't removing anything from our table or filling up drinks (self serve as well). I will keep recommending this place to everyone because the food really is great, you'll enjoy your creation. As far as everything else, there really will be flaws.

0BTPVInZABsBhIF1BzyWsw.text: Eat here every couple months and is a great place to get an affordable Asian fix. The restaurant GM is amazeballs, is extremely friendly and accommodating, She makes the visit all the more worthwhile. The food is as good as the ingredients you choose. Worth the visit for lunch or dinner,

0AFdfzWGMsS_fSq7QceIjA.text: Too much going on, place is filled with cross contamination and confusion plus the food sucked!!!

dGbwkuP6wAVnd1OP_o43GA.text: I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. Both times the food was just fine and service was good, albeit a little slow during dinner. My only complaint is the last time we went (and perhaps it was just that time) there was no music, no volume on the TVs, nothing to help drown out your neighbors' annoying conversations. If it's crowded enough, I suppose this could slide since everybody would just drown out everyone else. However, when it's quiet it's  hard to ignore that really loud person three tables away who feels his/her life is so fascinating that the whole world must hear about it! Or, maybe they're deaf in one ear. In any case, if Ghenghis Grill turned on some music, talk show radio, ANYTHING I think it would help with the ambience, and the unintentional eavesdropping.  Otherwise, food is great, service is good, restaurant is clean, and I'd definitely return (with headphones, just in case).

iLIBqliY_Cm516ihLOul_A.text: i will admit i am not exactly a mongolian grill expert.  i can take it or leave it.  but when a certain friend of mine visits from florida, i will always take him to a mongolian grill because he is a mongolian grill addict.  he has driven 2 hours (over 120 miles) just to get a decent mongolian grill in florida (shout out to BD's mongolian)..  well, we tried this place.  utter disappointment.  everything the previous bad reviews have said is True so i won't reiterate all that, including the ridiculous trouble of having trouble reaching the back ingredients.  but my biggest complaint was this:  what always made an overpriced bowl of veggies, rice and meat tolerable to me in the past was the SHOW!  you take your bowl up to a huge round grill, hand it over to the cook, and the cook puts on a show!  flipping food, twirling food, making fire over the grill, joking with the onlookers, all the things you see at a hibachi restaurant.    at genghis, you hand your bowl over to the cooks, and you go sit down and they bring it out to you.  i felt like i went to a movie only to be made to sit in the lobby to eat subquality popcorn that cost much more than it was worth.  and the service?  what service?  i waited a long, long time before a waiter showed up and i was finally able to ask for a glass of water that took a long time as well.  the place was not busy around 3 pm.  there's no excuse for poor service when the place is not crowded.  i usually tip generously but not this time.  my mongolian grill god friend says next time, he'll choose the restaurant.  i was embarrassed and thought it was a huge waste of a lot of money.

VP5RzKBGDhN73pL2dU6kOA.text: I love this place.  It allows me to get great quality and healthy food at a cost of only $10.99 per bowl.  The service is still getting up to par but it doesn't out weigh the food or the experience.  I wouled highly recommend.  I did find seating kinda cramped.

TE0c4nZzzuDkPxAWzsAvWA.text: this place is hit & miss every time we go there, don't go there and expect good service you will most likely get ok service at best...The food selection is great as long as they don't burn it, we are a family of three and sure enough EVERY TIME we have gone there one of us has gotten our food burned by the cooks, then it's a real pain in the arse to get your food re-done and by then the rest of the family is done and waiting..Bottom line, usually bad service along with 1 out of 3 meals being burt..=1 star..I will say this if you ignore the waitress and they don't burn your food it's a pretty good meal..

zBiNlVuNHQLEkm9VlfBCHg.text: The food is really good. It's fun to build your own bowl. Out server Lindsay was very attentive was a great server. I truly recommend this place!

1o4AK5YFz1q8NNX3z0wr9w.text: Genghis Grill is an ok place. The place is nice and like the idea of being able to customize your bowl the way you want. They give you so many meats, sauces, seasonings and vegetables to choose from you'll never run out of creative ways to make your bowl. Plus for the lazy person, they have bowls already created so you don't have to decide if choice is hard for ya lol. The biggest drawback is PRICE!! Average $10 for a bowl. The scary part is you can pile up so much ingredients and have it overflowing with goodness and BOOM!! When its cooked your bowl has shrunk lol. I was like what the hell? Did they drop half my food on the floor? Especially for the money. If your craving Mongolian, you can find better deals elsewhere. At the Fiesta Henderson Buffet, they have a mongolian section and you can customize your plate anyway you want for half the price and as the Fat Boys Song says, "All You Can" Eat!!" Until next time, Let's Eat!!!

LA0bV2NxLB_htCNKOk9beA.text: A complete dissapointment and very overpriced for what you get. On top of that, you have to wait at the grill while they cook your food.   The biggest classless blunder they made was placing a sign in front of the grill station reminding people to please tip the gill master and the wait staff.   A very tacky move.  Yes, the staff was very friendly and accomodating.........  If you aren't familiar with the Mongolian sauces and spices........you are better off going to a place that has the experience in cooking these dishes.   I wish them well.....I just don't expect to see them around when everyone gets bored with it.

KneOmq-Q8S0UVEoivOEKuQ.text: Hands down the best service we have had in Vegas in a long time. Food was delicious and the manager and wait staff were fantastic!

glLU8zUtF4pkEf5pLw-bjQ.text: Atmosphere: Very busy. Probably because it's the new and exciting restaurant that the LVJ just reviewed.   Service: Server was super nice and good.  But the line was LOOONNNNGGG.  It took 10 mins to go through the item line.  Then another 25 mins to wait for the food to be cooked.   Food: The bowl is way too small.  You can seriously only get like 5 pieces of meat and a scoop of one vegetable and then your bowl is completely full.  Come on now, it's an endless all you can eat, so why not give us bigger bowls so we can actually put in everything we want.  The sauce are all presented as American barbecue sauces, thick.  The real asian sauces are thin and taste better.  But I'm a Mongolian BBQ snob.   Bottom Line: Good choices of meats and vegetables.  The super tiny bowl was not helpful, and the super long lines made the endless bowl an endless wait.  A food experience, but I don't know if I have that kind of time to just sit and wait.  At $13.99 for an endless bowl, it's almost double what you would pay in California.

kc8LOXV7bAWGxlwaocP9cg.text: The food is amazing.  You get to make it how you like it and with so many options for meats, veggies, spices, and sauces, if it taste bad than you probably picked the wrong combinations.  Ive been twice in the last week and look forward to eating here again.  For $10 I got more than I could eat and took the rest home.  Yeah you can pay a few bucks more for all you can eat, but if you pack as much into your first bowl you probably won't need any more.  I love spicy food, so I made a bowl of seasoned beef, chicken, brocoli, lots of jalepenos, peppers, garlic and used 2 different sauces and it was amazing.  My wife and kid love this place as well.  I definetly would suggest giving this place a try.  The servers have also been very polite and the atmosphere is exactly what I would expect which is a nice cozy place to enjoy a meal.  This is now my 2nd favorite place to eat after (El-Torito Cafe)!!!

lLPU93uidbCI9Rnq_HLfLg.text: My My...There are some serious haters of this place. I'm glad that I didn't read Yelp before going. I actually went because two people in my office raved about it. I went there on two different occasions to buy gift cards for birthdays. I finally decided to go with friends. I've only been to one other Mongolian grill place so there isn't a lot to compare. All that I can say is that the service was mediocre and not terrible. The food was good. I like the concept of making your own meal with ingredients that you like.  My partner didn't follow instructions and put the sauce in his food bowl instead of the side bowl. They made him go back and put more sauce in the side bowl. Ultimately what happened was an inedible bowl. None of us can figure out why they made him add more sauce. It was too much sauce and not good. Three of us; however, enjoyed our meal. I didn't know that this place is a chain. Oh well...I'll go back because I enjoyed it. I'm not sure that my partner will though. The idea of the sauce makes him queasy,

WJmrFgijv0gzqmYTM5vKLg.text: The service left alot to be desired of.  As we arrived, the hostess was polite and friendly and seated us right away.  After that, everything went downhill!  We sat there with not so much as a greeting until the same hostess that seated us had to ask if anyone was helping us.  Finally our server "Twila" finally came and told us that she would be with us.  No sorry for the wait, just sort of it's busy, I'll get to you.  Then she came and then when it came time to explain how the place runs and how to get your food she basically said that she wanted to wait until the other table was ready so that she could take us in a group.  Yep, that's why I came out with my family, to make this a group event!  She must have noticed the looks on our faces because she suddenly changed her mind and said well I can just take you now.  Soon after we started eating our food, she came back and dropped off surveys and asked us to fill them out.  Could we have waited until after we ate to do this?  She then came back 10 minutes later and asked if we were going to fill out the surveys or if she should just take them back. Wow this place gives you mandatory homework with your food!    The food itself was just ok.  I have eaten at some much better Mongolian BBQ places but unfortunately they are out of town so my hopes were high for this place.  The sauces were a bit too sweet and thick.  The noodles were a bit undercooked.    At the end of the day the mediocre food is not worth the terrible service.

M7rXIiSr21ze2lMQnLrorw.text: Just had a weekday lunch here and it there was a nice crowd - so I was hopeful it was going to be GREAT! But after the so-so experience I don't think that were rushing back anytime soon.  Staff was great - we were seated and explained the process since we were 1st timers - we then followed her to the buffet line where you pick your own ingredients - so if it doesn't taste good - that's your own fault.  They have a menu board and the ingredients that go into it - but you have to make it yourself.  I tried to follow along - but got lost and just started adding what I thought went into it.  I would suggest piling up your bowl with your favorites and don't go too heavy on the sauce.  I didn't pile on enough so when my bowl came it was very sad looking - and tasted just OK.  We also ordered pot stickers which I would not recommend.  Tasted like it was frozen and just heated up, and the sauce was like it was from a bottle.  I would say it is FUN to experience this at least once - but don't set you expectation too high.  Remember - if it doesn't taste absolutely delicious - that is no ones fault but your own as  you chose the ingredients.

2_A7SIi1i_p7RpBOZ9bW_g.text: Read over the negitive reviews and I don't get it. I have lived all over this country and eaten at many Mongolian grills and the Genghis in Henderson is great. Complaining about the size bowls??? What, they are the size and everywhere else that I have eaten. Part of the skill at a grill is to know how to stack yoour veg and protein. I have never been there when the food was anything other than fresh. The comment about sauce not being cooked with the food? I don't get that either. Same with pricing. It is not over priced. I am just stunned by the reviews. Not at all with our experiences there.

fd0F4UsLkmlBtuiDZYCjGw.text: Amazing!  Glad they finally opened one here in Vegas.  They have one back in my home town and its always a big hit.  Honestly if you think it's not good its probably only your own fault for not fixing your bowl right.

xyX6Ld-VjJRoqJ5nAFXIsQ.text: I just paid to season my own food  too much cross contamination and they use the soda machines thats spray all the sodas out the same nozzle

kC2d56BF8PKxOKsy_BwHTw.text: This place is GREAT. My colleagues and I went here on our lunch and it was fantastic. The scenery & vibes was a 10. They checked on us and was very friendly. They explained to us how it work, we all chosen large bowls. We were told its no limit on how high we can stack it. Everything was cooked Perfectly. The taste was beyond grate. Flavorful and yummy! I can't complian! If you haven't tried it please GOOOOO NOW!!

e9Jl4CnOdfs-vY_SKMSW0Q.text: Can't go to Vegas without visiting this place at least once, my girlfriend won't allow it lol!  Great food, cool concept!

0XyqDBo9v7B6y7Ls2gTsIQ.text: I am upset that it took me so long to try this place. It's was absolutly fantastic!! The service, the atmosphere, the drink selection, the food!! Walking in, I didn't know it was anything like it was. First, you're seated and your server explains how it all works, they take your drink order, explain and offer some appetizers and then asks what size bowl you'd like..small, medium or large. Once you pick your bowl size, you then go up to the bar/buffet area where you put choices together. Pick from multiple different raw proteins and veggies...fill and pack that bowl with as much as you possibly can...pick your seasonings and then your sauces. Then, take your creation to the grill, pick your starch and give it to the cooks to put it all together and cook it all up for you. You can watch your creation come together or take a seat and your server will bring it to you. Our server today was Kelly and she was absolutely amazing. She explained it all perfectly and answered all of our questions. She even came up to the food line with us to make sure we knew what to do and to make sure we were 100% comfortable with what to do. We ordered the pork pot sticker appitizer which was amazing and my friend and I both loved the bowls that we created. I went with a chicken dish and her with a beef. I can't wait to go again and put some other stuff together. They have so many selections and concoctions that can be made..it's going to be an amazing adventure every time. I would recommend that everyone try this place at least once. You will not be disappointed!!

vntMXXSdxHeiWdjKbx15pA.text: My husband loves it!!! Staff very friendly. I wasn't very hungry so I got the salmon, it was amazing. Two thumbs up to my baby for a great pick.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon......Yum!

LkoCHbWk-whN5w7Ax1u3kA.text: I've been to this place in Phoenix and I was super psyched when one opened in Las Vegas! I'm glad it's here but it's not my favorite. I eat here about twice a month anyway because it's an easy way to get your veggies and it's cheap.  You go in, sit down, order your drink and get a bowl. Then you belly up to the bar and fix your own bowl. Drop it at the grill and your server delivers it to your table when it is ready.   THE BAD:  The bar is usually dirty which freaks me out. I know it's hard to keep the place clean but geez, sometimes it is downright nasty. The cooks also NEVER cook my bowls enough. I ask for it super well done / almost blackened and every single time my shrimp comes out opaque and I have to tell 'em to cook it more. I also experience tummy issues an hour or so after eating here...maybe from all the fiber? I don't know.   Another thing I really hate is that EVERY SINGLE TIME I have eaten here, the server has felt the need to comment on how many bowls I've eaten. We've had probably 8 different waiters and they all say something about it. I'm not fat (and there's nothing wrong with being chunky) but I can eat, and it makes me really uncomfortable when people feel like they have to say things like "wow, this is your THIRD BOWL?" Maybe corporate teaches them to do that so they will shame you into not getting another plate of shrimp. (And by the way, my bowls are usually 100% veggies; I don't like that meat that swims in its own...juices on the bar)!   THE GOOD:  You can pile on all the meat and veggies you want. It's fun to play chef and create a bowl with all the different dry spices and wet sauces. I usually pay the additional $3 to add on the all-you-can-eat bowl because it makes it easier to experiment. If you don't like the first bowl, make another.   The iced tea is freshly brewed and really good, and they have Coke Zero. I also love that there are lots of protein choices (marinated steak, chicken breast, shrimp, turkey, and more) and you can choose a starch (tortillas, noodles, rice) or just have none at all (I usually have no starch).   It's an easy place to get full for under $30 for two. I've noticed the crowds have died down significantly since the place opened. It used to be packed and you had to wait to eat but now you can walk in pretty much any time of the day. A decent place to go and one that I'll continue to visit.

1ilnlJ6bJfPVtcNdJcGktQ.text: The customer service here is excellent and I have never been displeased with the food. The employees are friendly and personable, and I really enjoy every visit. Super fast to go service also. The food is always full and fresh and lots of healthy veggies. The meat is seasoned well and I enjoy customizing my meal and trying new seasonings and sauces.

rH_KQDsewVkXE6hX9bPfmQ.text: I have been here twice now, and I LOVE IT. You get to pick everything you want in your bowl, from your meats, to your veggies, to adding seasonings, to creating your own sauce, and then picking what kind of rice or noodles you want. It is a little pricy, but it's sooo delicious that it's worth it! Both times I have not only had yummy food, but I have been shown great customer service.

pqb9CuFxNAypGyZCCfv7DQ.text: Unprepared for dinner rush. One person struggling to keep up with the raw bar. Didn't see the cards for combination suggestions until after I got in line. I don't know. But just not liking the vibe. Waitress was very nice.

Z0YYLZsLTN6CEVBVERdc7Q.text: Being a fan of Mongolian food I was curious about what this place had to offer. First time there was on a Sunday and the place was extremely packed and it took forever for the food to come out. Went in to dine there but because of the long wait got it to go instead and the waitress made a price change on bill which ended up being lesser than what it should have been due to wait. That was appreciated. The food was great when I got home to eat it so I went back the next day when it was not as busy and ate there and was completely satisfied with the food and service! Great place for healthy fresh food.

F4SKAfZEQYK3tA1yXOx6gA.text: Been here a couple times. My first visit I didn't really enjoy but the more I dined here the more I liked it and it really depends on your choices of ingredients that go into your bowl. They have a good variety of proteins and most come marinated or seasoned. They also have a ton of seaonings, sauces and veggies to put in. I always try to fit the most I can in my regular sized bowl and when it comes to my table I can't even finish it all so basically 2 meals from my regular size bowl. And like I said, how good the bowl comes depends all on your choice of ingredients. They also have new drink choices and I got the pineapple mint fresca and it really was refreshing and wowed me because I wasn't expecting it to be so good.

d1IjeLfzIvnr9AkmMqxLUw.text: I've been here numerous times, there are many options for meat selection and the food was really tasty.

2LGA8Vf3Dgz_3X7L5Kx9PQ.text: So, I must admit...I've never been to any other Mongolian grill. I know, shame on me. What kind of Yelper am I?! Even so, from what I've heard and read...this isn't the place to go for a Mongolian grill experience. I've been here a handful of times and it just seems to get worse every single time.  For the most part everyone who's been here or somewhere similar, you know how it works. But I was here this past weekend and watched 4 different tables get seated without anyone asking if they'd been there before or know what to do. Customers just stand there confused until someone comes back and for the restaurant, that's ridiculous. Sure, it's not hard to figure out but if you've never been anywhere like it, I imagine that's a frustrating experience. I hate their customer service for many other reasons so maybe my opinion is a little biased, but they definitely need to train the employees better. They don't explain anything to anyone, including the fact they you need to go get your own drink.   When it comes to the food, it's fun being able to pick your own stuff and make your own creations but like others have mentioned, they are always out of stuff. Then when it's busy and only one line is open, the whole entire experience just goes out the window because it feels so rushed. Also, I'm not sure if it's a health reason or what...but why is all the stuff so far away from the counter? I have to bend down and reach under that tiny area to get to items in the back. It's all just very annoying to me. The food is okay but I think they overcook everything, again, maybe for health reasons? The meats themselves always seem to be dry and chewy. If you get egg, it's almost like a fried egg that someone forgot to pull off the stove. There's just nothing spectacular.  I think it'll be a while before I go back. The service is crap, the food is mediocre at best and it's expensive. For 3 adults and kid to eat, it cost about $50 without the "all you can eat". When it comes down to it, I just don't see this experience or food being worth that much!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef, Steak, Eggs, Potatoes, Onions, Peppers &amp; Fried Rice

85NjX_h-uR_-Kk_kLEqiJg.text: My second time here and its better each time I come. I packed my bowl high and spiced it up. Sooooo yummy. This place is so fresh and delicious. Its a great healthy place to eat. My kids have no issue deciding what to have, which is usually an issue for us. They also have a supreme limeade mixed drinks menu with unlimited refills. I love the one with ginger, to die for. Definitely recommend this spot for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. I should have taken before I was almost done eating. Oooops!

s9yOLxXuEo6wofdqagAFMg.text: I love genghis grill!! My first time that I went I made a really small bowl but this time I piles it on!! They changed their system now. You pick a size bowl and then they give you a bowl to pile your stuff in according to your selection. PRICES went up people!! $9 for small $12 for medium and $16 for a large.   Udon noodles are delicious and the honey teriyaki is the sauce to go with!! WARNING...if youchoose to put calamari in your bowl...once the food is cooked and all is said and done it is very chewy because it was over cooked on the grill. So make sure you don't use that as a main meat source.  I love the coke machine. I can try various selections that I have never had much less never even heard of. Raspberry coke, interesting but delicious.  They did ask if I wanted a to go  box and they gave my daughter a to go box. So maybe the price jack included the to go box because before you couldn't take anything home unless you purchased the bottomless bowl which was damn near $20.  All in all a great place with great food....but bring a jacket because it is always and I mean always freezing!!

hyJb__UsBFRVKg04BODGng.text: This is my favorite chain for Mongolian. The food is delicious. The only change I would make is bringing back the all you can eat bowl as I still paid for two bowls.

Si1X5yx_REOnJ1FWX9k5Nw.text: Came here for dinner. When you enter, they ask if you've been there before and if not a waiter takes you to the line and explains it to you. Its a different process for a sit down place. We chose our size bowl, piled on veggies and meat and chose what sauce we wanted, and there's quite a few choices for each section, thats nice. Bring it to the cooks and asked if we wanted an egg and either rice, noodles, or half and half. The noodles weren't like regular mongolian noodles you usually get from these types of places, they were like udon noodles, i think, which was weird to me. They cook it and then the waiter brings it to your table. It was not bad, but also not great. It was hella pricey though. For a medium bowl it was like 10-11$ for dinner. I never pay that much for mongolian noodles esp for that amount of food. The waitress we had was super nice and always checked up on us so the service overall at the place was great. It wasn't busy when we went during a weekday, and there's plenty of room, it's quite big actually with large tvs hanging around. Booths or tables available. rALj4DbOvLDvLlP4jmes-A.text: We were shopping across the street when we got a big whiff. A strong smell of onions and meat came wafting down to entice us in to have some mongolian bbq for the first time. We followed our noses and went and got seated in this busy place. That is surely a good sign. WRONG!   The server asked us if we had been there before to which we both answered "no". She handed us our menus and really tried her hardest to explain how the operation went down, but she was a little tongue tied. Can't fault her for it. Who knows how many times a day she has to repeat the process to newbies like us. So she tells us how it works as we peruse the menu.   Most of the menu is quite unnecessary as we went and got everything for ourselves anyway. Why was there a section that displayed drinks when we had to go and get drinks for ourselves in one of those newer Coca Cola machines where there seems to be a millon different selections? That is the only good thing about that place unfortunately. The only thing the menu really should be is an appetizers menu. There were about 3 extra pages that could have been eliminated.   After ordering some chicken potstickers we were on our way. We went up with our bowls and got in line to pick our ingredients. Some of it looked suspicious. I thought it would be rude to put my head in and sniff for myself if the seafood or chicken went bad. I tried to play it safe and went with beef. I added a multitude of spices, garlic, salt, pepper, etc. to my mix. I was anticipating good things because the smells that were all around were promising. We got up to the place where they take our raw bowl and cook it for us. I decided on the spiral pasta. We got some drinks and sat down. I understand there were others ahead of us in line. I understand it was busy. I understand that Sunday nights are not the best time to get speedy service. This was taking forever! My boyfriend got his food first. It smelled good, but it seemed to be "barely" cooked all the way. He is not one to complain so he ate it anyway. My food came about 15 minutes AFTER his. Even though I was right behind him in line. My food was also barely cooked. The pasta was very bland. Even though I filled my little 'cup' of stir fry sauce up to the top it was not enough. Most of my food tasted like plain noodles with hits of flavor every now and again. Immediately after eating I felt sick. I know it was the meat. We were never checked on. I had to track down our server to find out about our potstickers that never came. She acted surprised. She asked us if we still wanted them. I said yes. I wouldn't have ordered something I don't want. It was a mistake. I should have said no. They came out rushed. She must have forgot to put the order in and was rushing the cooks. The skin was not fully cooked and was like uncooked pasta. Crunchy. Blech!!! Never again. No apology about the late appetizers. Just dumped it on the table and left. Not happening. We learned our lesson. We should have read the Yelp reviews before wasting our time and money (and my squeamishness) .

sjHkz76p4qhJ3mJziYMsPQ.text: This place used to be my favorite in town. However since i first started going there they have frequently upped the prices while making the portions smaller. Great quality and selection food-wise, but a bit pricey...

FVvAv26vAFP1Cp9YM4m1ig.text: I really enjoy this spot. It's close to home and the food is good. The staff has always been welcoming and helpful.   How does it work? The hostess will seat you and then a server stops by to give you a card that you'll take through the line. The first thing you'll choose in the line is the size of the bowl. I always choose the smallest because you'll add stuff at the end that will make the portion larger than it seems. The first section of food is all meat and seafood. Next up is vegetables and seasonings. The final section contains a variety of sauces. Lastly, you'll take it to the grill area where you can add options like eggs, fried rice, udon noodles, or pasta to name a few. While you wait you grab your drink and head back to the table to wait for the server to bring your food.  What do I love about it? You can create a variety of flavors and themes when choosing your meal. The meats, sauces, seasonings, and vegetables can be changed up on every visit to create completely different meals. One visit could be sweet-n-sour chicken and another visit could be a seafood dish with curry seasoning. The bowls come up pretty quickly so it's a nice cross between fast food and full service dining. The cost of the bowl is reasonable for the amount of food and a low cost option for a quick lunch or dinner. They also have a reward card to get a bowl free after 10 purchases.

-w-q3Id9vHNNiJXwasRpHw.text: I consider this a lunch spot, I don't think I would come here for dinner.  I also wouldn't ever pay full price to eat at Genghis Grill.  If you plan on eating here, I suggest signing up for their club to get your free regular size birthday bowl and other coupons via email, plus every 10th bowl free.  This restaurant falls somewhere between fast food and full service.  You are seated by a hostess, but a while back they changed it so you get your own beverages (Coke Freestyle machines), and you go down a buffet style line to pick your bowl ingredients, but you order appetizers and bar drinks from a server.  I really had to get over my fear of going down a buffet line of raw proteins (chicken, beef, pork, fish, etc.).  It scared me because of possible cross contamination, salmonella, temperature, etc.  After coming here on multiple occasions and not getting sick, my anxiety has lessened a bit, but I remain very careful.    Some tips: Make sure you season your meat or your bowl will be bland.  Pile your veggies high because they will cook down.  You can add egg to your bowl when you order your starch.  You can also pick up some toppings (peanuts, sesame seeds, chow mein noodles, and chili paste) while there.

QJb5Op2KVy3jxwFP3JyYBw.text: Surprisingly not too shabby! Another Dinner for two under $40 is a win for me and the BF. (Especially when I like to try everything)   This was me and my boyfriends first time here. The waitress will seat you. Around the Restuarant they have bowls to show the sizes you can choose from. Small, medium and large. Your server then brings over the 3 sizes of metal bowls. You then choose your size and explains what you need to do when you choose your meats, veggies and sauces. Our waitress also advised us that we should stack our meats and veggies as high as we can in the bowls.   We chose the medium size bowls. However, I made my decision based on the metal bowls because they looked smaller and thought to myself like girl you're still going to be hungry. Lol. And also thinking that the meat and veggies will shrink, right? But that was why I picked my bowl.   Next you take your bowls to where you pick what you want in your stir fry. For the meats there were a variety of them. Some seasoned and unseasoned Chicken, beef, pork, seafood. After the meats comes the dry seasonings. Anywhere from the usual salt, pepper, garlic to Cheyenne there was quit a few spices. Then you choose your veggies cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, zucchini, broccoli to name a few then lastly you will top all that off with the sauces. They had at least 6 different sauces if I'm not mistaken. Once you choose your sauce, you then take it to the next counter where you can choose your starch which is noodles, white or brown rice. Then they cook your food on this huge round grill. Head to your seat and your waiter brings you your food.  Before I end this, they have a pretty big drink menu and they looked yummy! They do have a bar as well, so you can order a nice little cocktail or beer. And if you don't want that you can grab yourself nice fruity Fresca (we got the raspberry/mandarin Fresca) they have flavored teas or the fountain drink which is that cool coke machine where you can customize your drinks as well. Btw, their non-alcohol drinks like the Fresca is refillable, Yay!   All in all it was good food because you get to pick what you want. The bowls are not too pricey. I will say, I underestimated those metal bowls because after you stack the meats and veggies then add noodles and rice the portions were HUGE for me. So I'll opt for the small next time. And another thing that they failed to mention is to not go crazy with the spices and sauces. Keep it simple because you'll end up with a big ol' salty mess. I learned that from another review and I'm glad I read it because you can easily make this the worst experience if you get a little sauce crazy!

zdCWesmJasZxJMDWk5_0vg.text: First time eating at this location, and the workers were very friendly and inviting. Food was good, I wouldn't given it a 5 star but I asked for for fried rice instead of steam rice, but in all it was still good

5T6Bu7XbKtctanHOe4JqLQ.text: I love this place because you choose what you want and how much you want of that item. When you are ready it is cooked and brought to your table. Every time I have been there the food has been great.

vilMO2zc9YMRqpI1osYRGw.text: The short of it: I'm not sure I would pay regular price here too often, but I always enjoy my free birthday bowl immensely. And it's gotten better the more I've learned to add enough salt and spices.  This is the only Genghis Grill which I've been to, and other than that, I haven't really had too much so-called Mongolian barbecue aside from mall food courts. The premise is that you can pick your own meats, starch, and flavors and have them cook it on a giant hot metal flattop.  The routine starts as follows: you're seated, a server asks you if you want appetizers or alcohol / bar seating (both of which I've never bothered with), and then you go to the line to choose your food. If you're lucky, there won't be much of a line and you'll get more time to weigh your options. If not, then think on your feet. As others have said, it's your own damn fault if you don't get a flavorful dish.  An employee will ask you if you want a small, medium, or large bowl. I thought I could have eaten a little more after the medium. You get to pick from a variety of proteins, spices and seasonings, and sauces. Definitely load your main bowl at least to the rim with proteins. I would stick to the ones that have recognizable meat texture, which for me were the marinated steak tips, pork, and marinated white fish. The chicken looked unappetizing and there was no way I was using the processed meats. Further down the line are various vegetables that you might also consider adding. I wouldn't add too many aside from mushrooms, onions, and maybe carrots since I'm all about meat.  The next two steps are so important that they get their own paragraph. You need to add spices and seasonings because there won't be enough from the meats, starches, or even the sauces. Use the tiny spoons to get several heaping spoonfuls of different granulated flavorings (such as garlic, ginger, cayenne, and yellow curry). Finally, you'll arrive at the sauces. Use a sampling spoon and try a sauce. If it's not that tasty, get another spoon and sample another sauce. Pick one or two that you like and ladle it into the small sauce bowl. I enjoy the 3G sauce, but you might not.  Finally, walk to the counter near the grill and present your bowl. They'll ask which starch you want. I picked udon noodle, but maybe you'll want rice or something. You can ask for 1 or more eggs to be added to your bowl here. They used to have eggs for you to grab in line, but I'm guessing too many of them dropped and broke. I believe you may be able to ask for a premade combination at the grill counter, but I wouldn't bother with that unless you're very lazy.  Grab a drink and maybe some condiments from the back area after you drop off your bowl to be cooked. They have those fancy Coca Cola machines that dispense seemingly hundreds of flavors from one spout. There's soy sauce, sriracha, and other things. Go back to your seat and wait an employee to present you with your bowl of cooked food. Eat and enjoy.  I will make this point again so that it's very clear. If you didn't add enough spices and whatnot, don't expect too many good things out of the bowl. You can probably still salvage it with the other condiments and some salt and pepper, and then you can berate yourself. It probably took me at least a couple of visits until I learned this lesson, and I'm so glad I did.  If you want a nice hot bowl of some Asian-inspired flavors with plenty of meat and some carbs, this is a good option. You know what flavors you're getting because you're designing the recipe, and that sure bet is probably worth $12 or so on a regular basis for some people.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Medium bowl with udon noodle, marinated steak, white fish, and other goodies

4gOfLxc-Zg7QW7GPNNeMnw.text: 1st time here was absolute best experience ever. Great employees and food is out of this world! Best food I had so far since I've moved here. Environment is very welcoming. It's about 6 miles from my house but it's is absolutely worth the drive.!

_ednDWWcC3_vLX7auYTm5g.text: We came to have lunch today and had an issue for the first time. Honestly, I've worked in the industry so I know it's going to happen eventually. It could have been very upsetting but for the most part I was happy with how it was handled. My husband ordered a medium build your own bowl and I ordered a large. Mine arrived first and seemed small but I thought maybe I was over thinking it. But when my husbands arrived and was WAY bigger, I knew there had been a mistake somewhere. We told our waitress, Sandy, and she went to her manager to resolve the issue. We weren't sure what was happening until she came back about five minutes later. She told us she fixed our bill and we were only charged for a small. But the problem was, we wanted a large. The price was never the issue. When we told her she sort of cut us off and said she can't do anything and she will go get her manager. The manager, kelly, came to our table and asked how we would like to resolve it all. She was very polite about it. I asked how much another small bowl would cost because I'm honestly still hungry and the small was gone at this point. She said that the bowl is on them, which was very kind. We never wanted a free meal, just a big one. I think my server misunderstood that. But I'm glad the manager fixed the experience.

tnrxB0pZM0J6NsUcYcAgAA.text: This is a choose your own adventure kind of restaurant.  How your food ends up tasting is mostly up to you.  They let you pile up your bowl as high as you want, so go ahead and mash some food down when you're stuffing it.  I was quite impressed with the amount of meats they had.  Chicken, pork, shrimp, beef, ham, turkey.  Big good sized shrimp too by the way.  I can't even remember all the meats.  Most stir-fry places have 3 or 4 meats, this place probably has close to 10.  The next station is seasoning.  There's about 12 options here as well.  I stuck with the cajun spices for the night.  Remember that just a couple of dashes is all you need.  Plenty of vegetables.  Tons of vegetables.  Mini corn, broccali, green beans, spinach, cabbage, pineapple, celery, mushrooms.  Tons of stuff.  Then the sauces.  I was recommended the Szechuan sauce by a friend and it was good.  I don't know what it is exactly....it's like a thin teriyaki sauce? No, that's not right.  I can't describe it.  In any case, it was good.  There was about 10 other sauces: "stir-fry" sauce, sweet and sour, teriyaki and more.  Unfortunately for someone who is watching their carbs, every single sauce is thickened up with wheat.  The last station is the "starches" which includes a few kinds of rice and a few kinds of noodles.  Tortillas was also an option.  I'm avoiding carbs where I can so I skipped out on this last option.  What really made me happy is that nobody made a big deal or cared about me skipping out on "filler" when I was doing the all-you-can-eat option.  With a soda and the all you can eat option, my total for one person before tip was $17.  It's not terribly expensive, but I'm not exactly impressed with the cost.

_eo_0kkpwwQFiN_ZBzPuDQ.text: A typical Mongolian BBQ place.  Nothing incredibly special but nothing terrible.  The only memorable part of our dinner was the company.  Compared to the place back home, it wasn't as good (and I didn't think that much of that place already).  Regardless, it was a decent--and cheaper than most places on the strip--place to fill our tummies before a night of drinking back on the strip.

cAzdqZCN8RgbqgZrztlADQ.text: No stars for this place! I am so angry it all started when my boyfriend and I walked in and were asked if we've been here before I said no but I've ate the food the waiter sarcastically ask well then how have you ate here, my friend brought her leftovers over and I've tried them, anyways our waitress Taylor was even worse she took us to the line and gave us the absolute worst explanation ever and walked away she didn't ask if we had any questions anything which I would have been fine with if she didn't have such a bitch face while explaining it. qArCMtlVoSUIkP1GL9E4MA.text: I love this place! I love all the choices for your veggies and meats as well as sauces and starch. So many varieties and options to pick from.  Relatively affordable and kid friendly! Recommend for quick easy and healthy lunch or dinner.

kLFUkZg1zWF63-HPzz4-XQ.text: Yes! This is what i've been looking for in Henderson. A bottomless mongolian grill joint containing multiple types of carbs and meats for your satiating preferences. when  you first arrive, you instantly notice the huge food bar to your left filled with steaks, beef, shrimp, marinated fish, PEPPERONIS, imitation crab, all sorts of goodies. FIll up your bowl and move onto the different seasonings (yellow curry was sickkness!), then onto veggies and your choice of sauces. So many sauces..it was hard to choose. Luckily it was bottomless so I tried 5 differnet ones with my 5 bowls!   my go-to combo: pepperoni, steak, mushrooms, bamboo, water chestnuts, with Dragon sauce and their special fried rice. Killer dish. I was literally in Mongolia..

23yiwq7toavqkArHNzSbyg.text: Pleasantly surprised and I trigger moreso than I expected. It's a step above Mongolian BBQ that I've had in the past. The selections are quite vast and the wide array of vegetables are super fresh. It's a yummy yet healthy option and filling for 10.99. $3 more and your bowl is bottomless but honestly I eat a ton and one bowl is good enough.   Pile the veggies up high and don't be shy; they do cook down!

104hibA3xw4iwpJoc3EZCw.text: Went here while waiting for my friend to get off work on a weekday which is cool because they have lunch menu and a dinner menu.   I ordered three large bowl and loaded it up. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars because I feel like they can have more options of vegetables to put in your bowl. Other than that great service great beverage station and food was very good and came out fast !

Q5ORfPtzR5YjIHqacslxAA.text: From the moment we walked in the door, everything was great!  The staff was friendly and explained everything to us as we were taken to the ingredient station, and the cooks were just as helpful making suggestions before they cooked our food.  Then our server, Katie, brought it to our table and it was delicious!  We will definitely be back!

_Ld9pRGqIAVRpTsPpPmH_w.text: Great idea for a restaurant. I love making my own bowl and then getting the free fried egg on top. Only thing I would change is they have a full menu almost but you have to ask for it. If you have allergies make sure to tell the server they take extra care of you.

GEHAr1ct6qnU3eM3nn3jAA.text: I had never done mongolian bbq before and I really enjoyed it !  You fill up bowls of frozen/uncooked meat and veggies and sauces and then they cook it for you on a giant wok or steam table thing and add rice or noodles .  The shredded beef  & the signature 3G sauce was the bomb!   I made mine way too spicy (my own fault for going crazy with the cayenne) but it was still so delicious!   & They had 16 oz shock top for like $4 which were tasty too   & our waiter Brett was so nice we loved him

hGV4Wbyi23cS-3lY7pTeIg.text: Took us late in the night and gave us great service ! Love the food ! Great place ! Been here many times!

76CZ0TxvakKtn_TEYpD77w.text: I'm actually pretty familiar with Genghis Grill during the old days of my Dallas misadventures.  I used to frequent the place quite often, and was sorry to lose it as one of my restaurant choices when I moved to the West coast.  Well, now it's back.  Or here, I guess is the better way to put it.  I've noticed reviews are all over the place for the restaurant, but my experience was good.  We got there before the dinner crowd, so we were seated quickly and ready to be served.  We did the "Build A Bowl" option, and for a $10.99 single bowl dinner price, that was more than fair, though the option to go "unlimited" is an extra $3.  Basically, there are a number of meats, vegetables, sauces and starches (noodles, rice, tortilla) to chose from.  You can choose how much you want of everything, and pick whatever ingredient options you want.  Because of the options, you can choose a lot of related things, or go for some pretty outlandish mixtures.  But it's on you if things actually go well together or not, so if you make something you don't like or didn't get enough.... Well, you made it, so there you go.  I created a veritable feast of meats, with enough garlic to kill off the cast of "True Blood".  You hang out, while they cook everything up on this huge circular grill, and after a few minutes, the meal is yours.  The options seemed to have changed/expanded since my initial Lone Star State visits, but really, all I cared about was my self-made meal.  And that's probably all I'll ever really care about during another return.  Service was pleasant and appreciative.  They also seem very conscientious about being respectful to food allergies.  While I have none, I'm sure someone will appreciate the extra "Is this okay" check-in.  Drinks were refilled quickly, the manager came over to chat and ask about our food experience.  And we got out just before they got slammed with customers.  And they do carry out, as long as it's not the "All You Can Eat" option.  All in all, I was pretty satisfied to revisit a familiar experience.  I will echo someone else's statement that I hope they open another location on the west side of town, because it's a bit of a drive, but nothing out of control.  Glad for a new food option.  I'll be checking it out again.

rZf9W68x5MrqWXdMoCmiug.text: Never had a bad experience here. Love the process. Build your bowl, give it to the cooks and go sit and relax. You do not have to stand and wait at the Wok like a goof like other grills. Great selection of meats and veggies as well. Love the sarachi chicken with dragon salt.

tdvO-0qsC1xGyCH8eO6d1w.text: We love the food and go only on Tuesday or Sunday when server Julia is working. She is the best. So nice and friendly. Wish she worked more days.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

UrbUF_l_s7KeUCqC9u988A.text: I have been to many Mongolian BBQs and have never been to one that I would not re-visit......until now!  When I was greeted at the door (not knowing anything about this particular place) I asked if they cooked on the typical Mongolian BBQ flat grill and I was told no. Then an annoying waitress sat us and explained how it works and then took us to the food section and pointed out the "protein", "veggies", "sauces" and "starches". We selected our food from the buffet-style area. The food containers were under a hood but were so low and far back that it was really difficult to get your food. AND, almost 1/2 of the serving utensils were lying down in the food where they could spread germs etc etc.  from people handling them and putting them back. The dish, that my food was served in, had a chip in it the size of a dime. (did not notice right away cause it had food over it) And last but not least.....I could not identify ANY taste that came with it. My mouth felt as though it was sticking together with glue. On each table was a mini-tablet that had video games and a few pages of ads for the food served within the restaurant. Not totally showing the whole spectrum of food but ....? The absolute best thing was that after your food is served, this little tablet called a "Presto" has your bill available to you and you can swipe your CC or Debit card at the table and get the hell out of there without any other dis-satisfactions.   Pros: Had a GREAT bowel movement the next day!!

5gj1jtzFZhLup9UrmqJMig.text: Genghis Grill has figured out a way for their servers to do absolutely nothing. Already there was no real "kitchen" for them to maneuver, and now they don't even serve water...you get it yourself. They were also out of straws on the day I recently went. Really? You're completely out of STRAWS? Not even for the fishbowl drinks you have? That's a mark of poor management not keeping simple necessities like straws in order.   I was sort of in a love affair with Genghis Grill when I first moved here, but really, it is not that good. They have cut so many corners since then that it's not even fun to eat here. I want full baby corns, dammit, not cut up that I can barely taste it or get it on my fork.   I would rather have Panda Express or Pei Wei than this crapola. Pass.

RGAgouNQ4QLrswJzgEd_7g.text: I actually really like this place. I love the fact that you can choose your own ingredients which are really good quality and they have soda machines that are really fun because you can make different combinations. We even got the tuxedo bomb dessert and it was really good!

9SdbDBNtGX2OG1Fzy24NCQ.text: Went here for the first time and boy I wasn't disappointed! Everyone was super friendly and helpful, explained how we order and such. And the food is delicious! Got shredded beef with some veggies and the udon and it was amazing! Definitely coming back soon.

hLMZFI43jwtDs8WJVeHg_A.text: The hospitality is AWESOME! So is the food! The variety of meats, seafood, veggies and extras will surprise you. Definitely worth the drive and $. Happy eating!

Ky4hMzCrNE3I03-30zOrCg.text: I love Genghis Grill. I first tried it when I was in Texas. Unfortunately, there aren't any close to me, so we try to go to the one in Henderson when we're in Vegas. We went Sunday and once again, we weren't disappointed. Everything was delicious and the staff was friendly. I believe out server's name was Brett ( I apologize if that's wrong) he was very friendly and attentive. I love the fact that you can fill up your bowl with whatever YOU want. So for all the reviewers that complained about how the food tasted, you are the only one to blame. You get to pick everything in your meal all the way down to the sauce. And don't complain about not liking any of the sauces, they provide tasting spoons so u can try them before committing. Genghis Grill is great! Everyone should try it at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Marinated steak tips, carrots, onions, celery, mandarin oranges, and the stir-fry sauce over white rice!! Yum yum!

F3hhEsvFXe838sff_QWrtw.text: They have 3 appetizers and we tried all three:  chicken lettuce wraps, chicken potstickers, and garlic citrus edamame. I really liked the lettuce wraps and edamame.  For $10, you get to build your ow Mongolian BBQ bowl.  They give you a silver bowl oand a side cup for your sauce. You first pick your meats: natural chicken breast, pork loin, marinated white fish, pepperoni, ham, turkey breast, sausage,marinated steak, sliced beef, shrimp, scallops, calamari. Then you season your protein with salt, pepper, garlic, ginger, cayenne, etc. Then you top it with your choice of vegetables. I wish there was more room for vegetables, because they shrink when you stir fry them. Then, you select a sauce (all MSG-free.)  The Honey Soy sauce was good.  Then, you bring your bowl to the grill and let them know your choice of: steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice, udon noodles, pasta, flour tortillas.  Drinks are separate. You go to the drink machine and there's a huge selection of flavored soda, etc.  Some of the meat was a little hard, but overall, the flavors were pretty good. And the service was excellent!

KWeeeZYfpa0QSsB3cCjR5Q.text: Does anyone at this location enjoy working there?!  BAD customer service! Started - From the bland hostess reception and snotty attitude for us asking for a booth type table and just throwing our napkins and forks on the table. Waiter took several minutes to come our table since he was visiting his friends at another table. We ordered Edamames and never got them. They brought out our food and we asked where the Edamames were and he said...oh...they did not have room to cook them...wtf?    When making our bowls, we asked the staff behind the glass area, about some nutritional information of the sauces...they were clueless and had NO idea how to answer other than NO. I just started here!  They need to be trained better!  We finally asked in the grill area and he showed us a nutritional chart and helped us.   Waiter finally brought us our check, after requesting for him to come back and he had to go find his Manager to use the Birthday Coupon we had.  You should not have to find a Manager in that small of a place!  The Manager must not have control of the restaurants or his staff!  The job seems pretty basic...something is off there!!  Oh...the food was good...but service sucks!

_eH2etUM9dqsKZqMw9s5cA.text: Terrible food! I've been to better Mongolian grills at a mall than this place.  You get small not very clean looking metal bowls that you have to cram your food selection into while trying not to throw your back out reaching like a contortionist for those back row items. The quality of the food is poor, the cooking is random, service is hit & run. 2 of us ate halfway through our less than mediocre bowls while one of us sat waiting for their bowl to come out. I ordered mine with the "fried rice"...most disgusting brown colored steamed (not fried) rice that tasted like it sat all day long waiting for a sucker like me to order it. For a week night dinner...3 bowls and 3 drinks with tip, our bill came to $50...WTF?! I could have gone across the street to Tony Roma's if I wanted to spend that! My stomach & wallet have banned this place for me.

eQMFVI_49WnT6QVCiBH57A.text: Hit Genghis few days ago with gf, and three others.  We were planning a "wild and crazy" night of bingo at the Sunset Station since the cash ball bonus was calling my name.  We get to the restaurant at 5:30 - place is busy so we opt to eat in the bar area.  Bingo is at 7 so this gives us sufficient time to go a few rounds , at least that's what we thought.  Bartender was attentive with the drinks, we even got lucky since there was an NFL game on so Happy Hour prices on beer.  Sadly, we get up to the food line and its 10 deep since they only have 1  buffet  line open.  we're told the 2nd line will open soon for the "dinner rush" - we're standing in line at about 5:45 - when does the rush begin ?  6?  7 ? Since the place is packed at 5:30 here's a crazy idea - open the 2nd line !!!  So we get through round one - only complaint on food - they were low on a few items and my usual complaint about the place - small bowls.  When we gave the bowl to the cook he asked if we wanted the food to go - we told him no.  So time for second round - it's 6:15 - we figure we have a 1/2 hour to get our food, eat then hit bingo.  This time, the line is about 15 deep - still only one line of food available - WTF !!!  I ask the guy re-filling to ingredients  who's the manager of the place, and he points to a guy manning the grill  - i'll share my concerns with him later.  In the meantime the line is moving at a snails pace.  And of course, i'm mid way filling my bowl when they OPEN THE SECOND LINE - thanks, thanks a lot !!   Given time constraints, when they ask if we want it to go, we say yes.  By the time we get our food, we have 15 minute to pay and leave and get to bingo.  While getting our stuff together, i ask the bartender for our bill - put the $$ with 20% tip in the bill folder even though not pleased about the time issue and the BS of only one line.  The manager comes over to ask how everything went - i expressed my disappointment about the one food line - she advises they open the 2nd line when the place gets busy - THE PLACE WAS BUSY WHEN WE WALKED INTO THE RESTAURANT ... nice try ! She then informs us we cannot take the food to go since we got the bottomless bowl. She had to make the smart remark, It's posted in the restaurant - it might be - i didn't see it nor was i looking - THEN WHY HAVE THE COOK ASK IF WE WANT IT TO GO ?  THEY SHOULD ASK IF WE HAVE THE BOTTOMLESS OPTION, THEN ASK ABOUT TO-GO.  If we can't take it to go then bill us for the one bowl option !  Thankfully she agreed, otherwise, i was really going to lose it .  I get the bill folder and pull out the tip.  F U GENGHIS GRILL - YOU'VE LOST MY BUSINESS

2ipLR2v_jejSW4ozq28geA.text: We stopped in for lunch on a weekday afternoon when we discovered the restaurant we'd planned on was closed. It was my husband and our 2 kids aged 3&5. The drink selection could be better...all soda and sugary yuck. Other than that, a great little spot.

Tortia chips as one of the carbs? This place is just a joke. Its like walking into a brighly lit apple bees but with none of the flavor.   You cant pay me to go back here.

sBnC38Llenwevupj8lipvQ.text: If I could give it 0, I would! We were greeted nicely, seated and shown what to do. After waiting a short time for our bowls, the manager came to chat and see how things were. They were great up until I found a ROACH in my food! They quickly took it away and offered brownies and another bowl for me. Reluctantly, I agreed to another bowl and went and made it. Got it to go so I could pick through it at home! The part that is really really not acceptable is that not one part of my meal was comped!! I have been a server for years and that is just unheard of! Needless to say we will not be going back! Our server Was super! But really, charging me for a bowl with BUGS! The manager said "it must have come in the cilantro, we get it in bulk and just rinse it" UGH!

DeodcmvE18cRyRMhcnGjtg.text: Stopped in for dinner tonight.  I'm never sure how to rate a place where you make most of your dinner yourself.  I give myself and the chef who heated up my food high scores, but the restaurant could have made it a little easier for a short person like me to get to the ingredients.  I found myself nearly laying on the ingredients to reach in the back.  Overall a nice enough dinner.

NoyiPaZKYIUBPwe-9TNhdA.text: My first experience here was amazing. The food was so good, the staff was very friendly. This time, once we got our bowls back from the wok, everything from the protein to the vegetables and the noodles were a dark brown to black shade. Everything tasted like pure char. They very obviously have not been cleaning the grill. On top of that, most of the protein I had loaded my bowl with seemed to had somehow vanished & I was finding random toppings in my bowl (i.e. onions, chicken) that I hadn't personally added. Not thrilled to have spent $24 on two bowls which ended up being charred to the point where they weren't even edible.

3XB5PPrv4ABpP4Miew_zVw.text: Dear Genghis Grill:  Be better. I really want to like you.  This would have been a four- or five-star review if we were just talking about food. But since the restaurant experience is more than that, I cannot overlook the consistently bad, astoundingly unacceptable service here.  I am not under the illusion that being a restaurant server is an easy job, but in the world of food service, waiting tables at a Mongolian restaurant is on the easier side of the industry, And yet probably about 80% of the time when I have been here, there has been some issue with the service.  In most cases, the issue is, people aren't where they're supposed to be, pretty much ever.  I have walked into the restaurant and waited at the podium for ten minutes waiting for someone to seat me. because the hostess was MIA.  I've stood at the empty grill for five minutes waiting for the cook to come back to take my food..  I've sat at the bar for 15 minutes waiting for the bartender to show up so I could order a takeout bowl.  I have sat staring at my cooked bowl sitting on the counter getting cold, counting the number of servers who walked past it.  I can't figure out if they're always understaffed, or just clueless. Nobody does their job.  I have been waiting for years and years for a Mongolian place to open in Vegas, and I'm on the verge of writing it off forever.  This isn't rocket science. There is simply no legitimate excuse for the service to be this bad at a restaurant where the task of serving food is so simple.  I do like the food here but I honestly can't recommend it based on the uniformly terrible service. I can overlook quite a bit in terms of restaurants but everything about the service experience here is just frustrating.  I'll be back once you get your sh** together.

Bf5cCj1K6ykE8Lm17uRGfg.text: Went here for the first time over the weekend.  It was fun and delicious.  The staff helped us through the process and there were suggestions on how to create specific dishes.  There were a lot of items to choose from for the bowls, from chicken and beef to scallops and pork.  There are also a lot of vegetable selections and at least 10 different sauces to choose from.  They have a huge assortment of soft drinks and a full bar as well.  Additionally they do have a couple appetizer selections to choose from and a limited dessert menu with a cheesecake and brownie selection, among other choices.  I had a small with fried rice and was satisfied.  I wish there had been less rice in the bowl so the veggie meat rice ratio was a little more balanced but overall a great dish.  Others in my party had the large and medium bowls.  Again, despite filling their meat and veggie dish to the brim, I still felt like their noodle to other stuff ratio was a little off balance.  All in all, a good experience and we will be back.

6uvxZvWrjPo1dhXpoHTGIQ.text: Husband and I stopped in for a bite. Clean and friendly. Staff explained how it all worked and the margarita was delicious. Seems family friends and hit the spot.

g9qd7bHCxTmC0rQZejkIMg.text: We loved the greeting and our server. She explained the process extremely well. Yet, when it's busy and people ahead and behind you, it's a bit overwhelming. It all turned out fine and delicious. We will be back!!

Thewaitress was slow and not nice almost all meat is gone line was super backed up and dust on shelves like it has not been cleaned for weeks. And this is not the worst part. I got food poisoning and was sick for 2 days . Stay away

2cEFydHvxF2hG_dE7aNyhQ.text: Food was very fresh and tasty! The service by everyone including our server Wendy was friendly and great atmosphere all around. We will definitely come back again

1NsvMEBFjmlrko2eAhZ1Ew.text: Genghis Grill. Yes, I am hooked. I love that you are seated at this location first, upon being seated the waiter/waitress will take your drink order and then ask you which size bowl you would like. Small, Medium or Large. I can't imagine eating a large bowl medium does myself good! The magic is in how you pack your bowl, pack that thang (thing) to the top guys! Seriously put your veggies on the bottom and mush the heck out of them, lol build a wall with your meat on the side and like a Lego keep building up! Yes this meal prep is that serious! But let me back up real quick and explain. Upon picking your bowl size you will then get up and walk to a selection of veggies, protein and sauces to dress your meal up just the way you want, spicy, garlicky, sweet or savory the choice is yours. Once you complete your bowl you will be giving another option to add rice or noodles to complete your creation and stir fry it all up!  It cooks wayyyyyy down once fried and this is way I say pack it on and mush it all the way down in the bowl! I love my creations and this fun restaurant. Drink options are the soda machine, fresh juice, wine or an alcoholic beverage! My go to is always a mojito. Bowls run in the price range of $9.00-$15.00

95X9MP4tEwlizNlGIeE-xw.text: I've only been to a Mongolian Grill once, but this was my first time here. If you're a newbie like I was, the server explains what to do:  1. Choose the size of your bowl  Pile as high as you can -  2. Meats 3. Spices/seasoning 4. Veggies 5. Sauce(s)  6. Then bring your bowl to the grill area (be careful not to spill anything) 7. Wait for your dish to arrive!  It may seem a bit overwhelming at first since there's so many to choose from. But if you know what you typically like, and after sampling the different sauces, your bowl should come out tasty.  Everything was delicious, except my veggies seemed undercooked.  I recommend to mix your bowl before eating since majority of the sauce stays on the bottom, and get 2 sauce containers for a regular sized bowl (3+ for the large bowl).  The price is very very reasonable! The prices are around: Small = $10, Regular = $11.50, Large = $13 The serving size is HUGE!!!! A regular could feed me twice... And I eat a lot.  The service was average though. My party arrived 1hr before they closed (closing hours were earlier from what was noted in Yelp), so the server was in a bit of a hurry & we had to rush our stay. Nonetheless, we still had a good experience.  I'd definitely come back to create a different bowl!

Pa5u0q00Akm765vjP5tj2A.text: It was too dirty to eat after I looked around. Wet utensils, wet stacked glasses. Soda fountain was out of wack. Disappointed.

ufPpXOx-fB2YLOCU0TaZdQ.text: I like the concept but for newcomers like myself it was a little offputting. When you arrive you are seated first and you chose from a small, medium or large bowl. Although the bowls all look tiny they contain quite a lot once it's full.  My word of advice: Don't get greedy! There are plenty of options to choose from whether you want veggies, meats or sauces. They are all relatively fresh and pretty tasty. The only reason why I give them 2 stars is that it becomes waaaay too easy to butcher up your dish if you mix and match too many sauces and meats.  I went there with my buddy and it was both our first time. Both our bowls came out incredibly salty and it was just an explosion of flavor. I put a pinch of the dragon salt, had a few meats that were marinated and a cup of the sauce and I guess that just made my bowl extremely salty. Can't blame anybody because we chose to add the dragon salt and other sauces ourselves, but before we started we told the servers we were first-timers and I wish she mentioned to go easy on the sauces. That would've been very useful.  I would like to try it again next time but it wasn't a very good first experience.

cFaMcnaw6G_PlJB7C_rWWQ.text: When here because I love Mongolian because I should of know not to eat here when I guy ask if I was allergic to any.... I didn't know of any until eating here... I had to go to the emergency room because my allergy attack was really bad so but not eating here again

YV0uUch7QMT1KVn9hsHaeA.text: For a Mongolian style grill, Genghis Grill isn't bad but there are other formats which are much more flexible.   The chicken was alright but my wife's steak tips were tough. They were out of Teriyaki sauce which was disappointing but we made due with the Honey Soy. They have way too many syrupy sauces. Not very calorie conscious.   The server was very good.  He was attentive and friendly. He got a good tip.   For improvements, they need to serve the rice on the side so we control how much. I heard they also own BD's Mongolian BBQ. Yes or no, they need to convert to their format of doing it.  We'll be back since for the price it's a nice night out.

i56GIDSS7nGv6kQw_EXuTw.text: Love this place, been so many times and it never fails. Brought my boss here for lunch. Now hes a fan too. Great service too.

DQTRfLHjM1tzcA7juYKcCQ.text: Food wasn't as great as other Mongolian grill restaurants and took a while to get the food. Wouldn't choose it as a first choice service wasn't to bad but the process seems to much to do for eating food. Basically a self service place not worth the money.

Qu_TWAQRYd_5fiITi2MMew.text: I pass by this place all the time, but that was a mistake by my part. The food is piping hot and very tasty! And jaakko's served us well. It's fun to eat because you get to fill a bowl with raw ingredients, and watch the cooks prepared for you. The rice was a little dry but the noodles were so good. Look at the pics

pcgwvQ5xo7kpiO9kgSvU0w.text: Just got an email saying that their Bottomless Bowls are back for good.  It's about time!  See you soon Genghis Grill...

V9na7l-KzllHNqnjA2RHHQ.text: Pretty good food, great flavor, nice portion sizes no matter what size bowl you get. You can definitely do healthy meals, if you don't get a starch and just stick to meat and vegetables. Overall pretty good

ybLZ1C1juX6g22m2sa0aKA.text: Self serve Mongolian Grill in the Las Vegas suburbs.  You get a choice of three different sizes of bowls to start. You bring your bowl to the selection bar. You start by filling your bar with your choice of meat and/or seafood. You then add vegetables, fruit, and spices. You then bring your bowl to the grill area. You can tell the chef to add up to two grains like rice or noodles. The chef takes your bowl and cooks its contents.  The waitress will bring your bowl to your table when it is ready.  I was pleasantly surprised by the taste and process. The waitstaff was friendly.

Y3W4x91UgMNlC0AXuEKchQ.text: For the most part, service is always helpful . . . If not a little slow at times. The food is good, hell, hard to mess it up when you create the mix of food. We go often.   My only major critique is that we are regulars, and most of the staff acts like they do not know us. Each time they ask if we have ever been there before . . . REALLY? Kinda bugs me.

0ZI09qgheO4cy86W-gsejg.text: We stopped in not knowing what to expect, our dinner was delicious! You go down a line and build your own stir fry, there is a great variety of food, spices and sauces. They staff was friendly and we look forward to going back.

s9TiWr4lRT6FywwLsrQxDQ.text: It's basically a stir-fry place. You pick your goods then sides (noodles or rice) & they stir fry it.  The food is great. If you're vegan, you can eat here by customizing your order. There's plenty of veggie options and sauce options. If you like meat then pile it on. My only dislike about this place is the soda machine is self-serve. And the sun shines through the door & blinds you at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Medium bowl is a good option.

YJePQ39Xqd0k5DTH3BQtZg.text: The food was delicious, the service was ok, and the prices are atrocious. The quality does not nearly justify the price you pay for a bowl. I got a large bowl and a drink and the total came to just under $20.

8hq6Xdj4TsoCAdxIDugwPQ.text: Good amount of ingredients, long wait, and small amount of food. This place is o-k, for 9$ I could get full anywhere else. But the tablet ordering device was really cool, and so was my server. Try it out !

Zqyq-uc-JWcHw6FYce1bNA.text: The best Mongolian grill place in Vegas, hands down. The staff is attentive and friendly, and it's a great quick lunch or dinner. I just wish it was a bit closer to my home, and I'd eat here 3 or more times a week!

PrAzT60eUcAepYu8lks2MA.text: I love to go here and the staff is good for what they do. The only past they do is bring bar drinks and your food after they cook it.

FDMLxa6oprEKqntvtgqTpQ.text: This place is fun!  I love making my own dish!  Still trying to perfect the perfect dish but having fun trying.  I would love to see more seafood selections in the meats and other noodle selections.

jBl2q1Y_rmxBDeNbRu3UQA.text: Over priced for sure.back home they have these all over and you get unlimited trips for $12-15 and the quality is higher. So when we ate here and it was that expensive and it's not even unlimited we were disappointed. Just okay. They do have good coupons out in the paper that never expire. You get 2 meals, 2 drinks, and a dessert for $22. Not too bad.

Xv1Q4LQW-rzzoWQAJtaNWA.text: We end up here about once a month. The food is good and I like the idea of choosing my own ingredients and flavors. I am bothered, though, that the service is consistently blah. I don't know what is happening with staff, but something is bringing them down.

XBCRPhv7yGaAEumQb0GvaQ.text: I definitely like this place for a routine fast casual staple. It can use some improvement though. Fork was dirty. Lighting is too bright. Going a little dimmer would give a better ambience. Place was busy and food was fresh. Service was good. Their system and training showed. Sample spoons on the sauces were empty. Only had red cap soy sauce and not green.
