uPDaTAa5YTzfbwCQ56FqMw.text: A very updated and modern version of Mongolian BBQ. This chain offers some very contemporary items, such as Pico Gallo, crab, veggy mixes, etc. Super clean location, with an extremely cheerful and helpful staff. Also, whatever you don't finish, you can take home. A tad bit pricy for this style of dining, but nothing that would discourage anyone from a healthy option for lunch or dinner.

iQ7hH4fxAp4uWC9ObLqqgQ.text: The food here is okay. However if you are on any sort of time frame don't come here. It took us approximately 40 minutes for us to get our food. Also if you expect to be waited on don't come here. You get your own drinks, build your own food and pay at the table. The only interaction I had with any employee was to be seated, when we asked where our food was, and when our food arrived. Nothing beyond that. This visit was a disappointment.

9gPRRX7VaB72hVKCSgZsIA.text: Food was fabulous. We went there this afternoon. There was a nice crowd there but we were sat right away. They have a 5 step process to making your own "bowls". After going through the buffet style station, you bring your bowl to the cooks and  they get the show on the road. Our lunch was done and on our table in about 7-8 minutes.  My only complaints aren't that serious but still bothered me none the less...  1- It was bitterly cold in there! I was literally shivering as I tried to eat lunch. I'm not one to get cold so for me to be FREEZING.. the AC was definitely on too high.   2- While going along the line making our bowls, there were three rows of random ingredients. I couldn't reach the back row! My husband had to reach anything I wanted for me. The woman behind me had the same problem. Not everyone has gorilla arms! Cater to everyone please! Buy longer spoons!   Outside of that, everything was great. Our server "Sasha" was very informative and was knowledgeable. She answered all the questions we had about sauces and food allergies.  Will be back again soon! Yum!

s9jHWY1dgjUHuX9UC90enQ.text: Went twice since opening. Both times ended up with bubble guts. The last trip (today) I couldn't even make it home.   Will not be back. And I grew up loving and craving Mongolian BBQ, but I can't stomach this place. *pun intended*

2utZ2LbkMoqX91bdrYblBg.text: Went he for lunch and it was not overly crowded (yay!) Our waitress came, took our drink orders, asked about food allergies and (because I'm new to Mongolian BBQ) explained how the process works. Having a recipe chart up on the wall really helped. I went with Beef & Broccoli but was able to add ingredients I enjoy, but aren't normally in this dish. It was fantastic!  I had peach tea to drink and it was very weak in peach flavor. It wasn't sweetened, which for me is a plus. The only negative is the big f-ing gong the cooks beat like an enemy if/when they get a tip. If the gong bothers you don't tip them.  Will definitely be going back again in the future.

tcXPQfdg8pCKQ1qfbHKmYQ.text: Wendy was a GREAT server. Super sweet! Love coming to eat here with their variety of selections to chooses from when building your own bowl. Now, my clumsy fiance accidentally spilled my drink & the hostess Breonna instead of acknowledging  it & helping us out with finding out server to alert someone about the spill, she just looked at it and continued on with her business. Not cool (I've been hostessing for 5 years & I know better ). My fiance went to get the server himself. Thank you Wendy for you awesome service & thank you genghis for the great food!

X4-ggawLwYl7Z3LPw5ggJg.text: Love this place. Make it exactly how you want. Danielle, our server was awesome. I chose medium which was more than plenty. I made steak and bacon bowl with broccoli, baby corns, steamed rice and had the egg added at the grill. With the teriyaki sauce it was great. Enjoy!!!

uJuTblcLXkHCeoGdk44anw.text: This place is fun! They give you a card with your name and table number on it, then you walk through a buffet line to choose your uncooked ingredients. You then leave them to be grilled and eventually returned to you at your table. It's hard to review the food here because you create your own. If you don't like the finished product, well, it's your own fault. It's a matter of trial and error. I've been here 6 times so I know which meats and veggies I like and which seasonings and sauces--there are lots of choices, some spicy, some not, but for me, less is better. I like the teriyaki sauce and the honey soy with a little salt, garlic, and ginger. The important tip is to fill your initial bowl to overflowing because it will cook down. I find the small bowl is enough for me, but they have a medium and a large. You also get to choose what to put you meats and veggies over--white, brown, or fried rice, udon noodles, pasta, tortilla, or cabbage. Our server tonight was Katie and she was very attentive and friendly. As we went up to the buffet line, she said she would check back later to see if we'd done a good job! We had!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. My usual: Chicken, Turkey, Fish, Mushrooms, Water Chestnuts, Sprouts, and Egg over Rice
Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken, Turkey, Fish, Egg, Mushrooms, Water Chestnuts, and Sprouts over Steamed Rice

2xUMJEngXdC8IEEwdSGhjA.text: This place use to be good but now you only get one trip and have to pay upwards of 15 dollars for one bowl.  The whole point of this style of eating is to be able to experiment new creations and try maybe a couple small trips.  I am very sad they changed and as the waitress mentioned they have a lost a lot of business including ours now.  If management knows they are losing business maybe they should revert back to how this style of eating should be.  Last time I'll be there!

6w-Dzzd0636yLo6fEM49zg.text: This place made both my sister and me sick.  We will not be going back.

53DVmWCpr7aaRlTNu4PwMQ.text: I don't know why everyone is complaining.   The food is good for the price.  Especially when you do the unlimited for $4 more.  We had excellent service.   The wait staff was more than attentive then some other places we've been.  It's not fancy but food and service were above par.

rmDFFBh9BzM7lqdqxhsWzg.text: I'm not a "yelper" at all but I am a server in a fine dining steakhouse on the strip so I know and appreciate good service when I get it and I always get it here. My Son and I make the drive across town for the food and have become regulars bcuz of how amazing it is. We've taken a liking to Tayler as she is always sweet and welcoming and goes out of her way to chat with my son about his baseball games, she's efficient and always makes sure we have everything we need. The time or two we didn't sit with her she made it a point to stop by and say hello. Amazing food..Amazing staff! Pineapple cake a must try!!!!

X65GbOEBKV3sw4Bxya4-2Q.text: Really tasty, but expect to wait at least half an hour to get each bowl. I've been to a similar business out in Arizona and it was only 8$ for unlimited bowls instead of 15$....so it's a bit pricey for what it is. Dining room is also a claustrophobic little maze that's hard to navigate. The bowls that you get to select your ingredients are way tinier than they should be for 10$ and 3$ for a tiny bowl of edamame is laughable. Great potential, good flavor, but too high of price and too slow of service to be really excellent.

rKdJP63MVlRwHWylOw6Dkw.text: This place is so yummy!! You have to try it. They have 'Create your own bowl' or specific mongolian bowls. And other goodies. I love cooking so I always hook up my own bowl and I am never disappointed. They have all the meats to create your own bowl and vegan options as well.

K8O53vFyY-Tufi4sT5DNVA.text: If you look at my past reviews, you'll notice that almost all my reviews are 5 Stars.  I just like sharing really good experiences with fellow Yelpers, who have always guided my way through culinary cravings or service needs.  And when I usually have a bad experience, I just let it go, mainly because I feel bad posting a negative review.  Not tonight!  I've been to Genghis Grill 3 times, and the last two experiences were both poor.  The first experience was a sit down experience with my wife, and it was a pretty good experience.  Nothing compelling enough to write a review, but a good overall experience.  So a couple weeks ago, we decided to place an online order for 2 large bowls.  They have a pretty impressive website where you can pick and choose your ingredients as if you were at the restaurant.  But unfortunately that's as good as it got.  After picking up our order & taking it home, they had mixed the ingredients between the two orders.  We gave them the benefit of the doubt, made the most of the meal, and called it a night.    So tonight, we thought, if we eat at the restaurant, it's pretty unlikely they'll mix the ingredients since you pick it out yourself.  Sadly, we never even got a chance to place our order.  After being seated, our waitress Taylor asked us for our order.  We told her we wanted 1 large bowl, since the last time we placed an order for 2 large bowls, it was too much food, and we only ate 1.  I told her if we're still hungry afterwards, we can always order more food.  She then snidely says "you want 1 bowl for everyone?", scoops up all her remaining bowls, and walks away, taking her unappreciated attitude with her.  I don't believe she even took our drink order.  So we left, and decided to dine elsewhere, and found a much more accommodating restaurant.  I get it.  I used to be a food server.  I understand that the bigger the bill, the larger your tip.  But treating your customers poorly and being rude is simply inexcusable.  For this, you have popped my negative review cherry, and I leave my first negative review.  =)

lKeELM3hpseBSXXi8k2N3g.text: I love this place! Have been here 4 times now and plan to keep coming. Service is great, especially our server ALYSSA. She was such a sweetheart and made sure we had a great experience!

wW3TXwqLTlA3oFsNZVQ3DA.text: I'm a every-other-month regular Genghis eater.  I'm all about my own design and have these tips for you.  Go for the LARGE unless you are one of those that doesn't do leftovers.  If you make it right, you will want it again.  For the $ difference you can stretch the larger portion.    Fill your bowl and pack the content down.  I like to add a lot of spinach and cilantro to mine and they take up room, so I smush it down.    DON'T go heavy on the sauces.  Some of the veggies are water holders and can make your stir-fry watery.  That doesn't do well for left overs.  With the large you get three choices for "base" of noodles, something, something-I go for 3 portions of cabbage.  Try it, you will never miss the calories from the carbs.  Since you get to create your own meal here, it can only be as good as your choices.  In this place you can make smarter ones and have all the flavor you thought you would miss.  Good luck and have fun!  Oh and sign up for the Genghis customer card.  A free bowl on your birthday, isn't it nice when someone buys you lunch that day?

vU4-6XfvK48zEY6fbWA66g.text: Create your own bowl!  There is never a wait (if there is, it is a small wait).  Plenty of seating.  When you get to the food station to create your bowl, there are posters on the wall that give you recommendations on how to put together certain dishes.  Meats:  They have chicken, pork, beef, and marinated sirloin tips.    Seafood: Calamari, crab, fish  Vegetables: choice of bean sprouts zuchini, green beans, japapenos, and a bunch more (this is all from what I can remember because I'm not really a vegetable person).  Spices:  There are an array of spices you can choose from.  Honestly, I put a little bit of everything and it turns out awesome.  My favorites are the ginger, garlic salt, and lemon pepper.  Sauces: So many to choose from.  When you bring your bowl to the counter, you have your choice of carbs.  I usually go with plain rice.  You can also throw in 1 or 2 eggs (to make it like fried rice) if you want.   At the end of the counter, you can find toppings such as crispy noodles, peanuts, and seasame seeds.  They cook it at the grill, so when you get your food it is going to be HOT!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef, marinated sirloin tips, calamari, crab, zuchini, onions, and eggs over steamed rice

5D3Aab8FkPkQq7xjnHBYUw.text: The food was good, the waitress was excellent but the place is FILTHY. Our shoes were sticking to the floor near the food and the area where they were cooking was gross. I don't know why it hasn't been reported.

qmqGHlDIqZfiFOk0WxDc2A.text: Very much like the Flattop Grill in Chicago, though with this I think you just get one trip? That part was unclear to me. The build your own stir-fry is great if you know what you like, and how to combine flavors--not so if you can't! "Salad bar" seemed clean, though the floor did not. Refill your own drinks. Seemed quick and efficient. They are part of a rewards program.

IylbFyj3gHvjJGVtQnD8Sw.text: Wow!  I loved this place!  I had no idea what to get, since I'd never been there before, but it seems like it's a win no matter what you might choose.  I can't wait to come back here many times to try different combinations.  The staff here are all super nice people, and our waitress checked on us lots of times to make sure we were taken care of and enjoying our meal.  SO so good.  If you haven't tried this place and you're looking for something different, go for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. It was so good I forgot to take a picture before I ate half of it!  Oops...

5NGgvllpXCbBYkia0Ori2A.text: The first time I came here, I  want overly impressed but my parents were wanting something a bit different. So we have Genghis a shot. I have to admit they have made improvements. Mongolian BBQs are becoming difficult to find so this is a fun experience.

heUX3VJApADyTMopaHdYGQ.text: I absolutely love this place! I came to lunch here with a friend, since he has been trying to get me to come here for a while. I give in and decide to go. As I walk in I am automatically greeted and seated. The waitress showed me three sizes of bowls to choose from (small, medium or large) and explained that I would need to go to this food station and pile the bowl as high as I could with whatever meats and veggies that I wanted, pick any sauces and hand it to the chef. I was honestly intrigued! I for sure picked the large bowl!       When I went to pick my meats, I had to try everything! They has garlic lime chicken, sriracha chicken, beef, pork, Korean beef, crab, calamari, scallops and more! I almost made the whole bowl nothing but meat. I decided to balance some veggies nearly on top. I then picked the two hottest sauces they had. One was a Chile garlic and the other was a sesame soy sauce. After I was finished I gave it to the cook and was asked what kind of rice or noodles would I like with it. If you get the small bowl you get to choose one, medium bowl gets two choices and the large bowl gets three. Since I had the large bowl I chose the Udon noodles, brown rice and spiral pasta. It took about 10 minutes for everything to cook and be served to my table.        The waitress came by our table to get our drink order. I was surprised when she told me that all the specialty lemonade came with unlimited refills! So I ordered the Jalapeno Mint Limeade, the Passion Ginger Limeade and the Raspberry Basil Limeada (made with Raspberry Jam). When my food came out to the table, I was pleasantly surprised on the portion. The taste of the food was flawless. The spicy didn't start living in till a quarter into my dish. The service and food was really impressive. I for sure will be returning soon. The end.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Meat selection 2

ZJWaWIVy_7fDGhMZmTAZgQ.text: Start with the food was good an filling lots to choose from an the location is not bad , but for a place that you have to serve yourself make your own food with mid grade quality meats an veggies they sauce some of the meats to add better flavor, but the price for this is a bit high for what is offered an with one line to wait in as you shuffle down picking what you want it is not worth the price 20. Per person cheaper to go to a buffet . Nice to try once but probably will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

kUBiUJzStJNI7mNMZYDvLA.text: If your looking for something fun and not just sit down and serve me then this is the place. You grab your bowl and fill it with choices of meats then down the line you select veggies and then sauce it up!! Then it's grilled perfection and deliver to your table. It's fun to choose what will go well together. Each person can make their bowl to their liking!!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

lVYbw0C0fhhfJL8jIfPGsQ.text: Austin is a horrible server!!! We were sat and waited 15 mins. Kept making eye contact with our sever & he kept running off! To top it off, they seated a part of 5 AFTER we had been waiting 10-15 minutes and he immediately went to them!! I like the food here but we walked out on him & didn't order anything...feel like never coming back after Austin's horrible customer service & serving skills!

VO4bn8Nf05lmCTP3oQV7cw.text: Tasty bowls of delights!  But I have to agree with an earlier comment that the prices ARE a bit high. On the plus side, though, they do offer free birthday bowls which I took advantage of. Today is my birthday so we didn't have to pay for a Regular bowl which is normally priced at $11.49.  Hubby chose a Large bowl which was $14.49. Prices are subject to tax, of course. If not for the birthday discount, the price would have been $25.98 plus tax. Since the bowls are rather on the small side, I would have to agree with reviewer Chris V. who posted about 5 months ago.  The other Mongolian grill we've been to was in Utah and we don't remember paying as much -- even with paying for 2 bowls -- and they were good too, taste-wise.  Genghis Grill has a self-serve soda service which is separate from the bowl price.  All in all, we had a delicious and filling meal which rounded the day off to a beautiful ending.

1AFmnHj5ShF94q21_xj1YA.text: Rounding up from 3.5 stars.  This place is pretty generous with their servings, and we always have leftovers so the price is decent. I like how you put all your meat and veggies only and they put the carbs on so you don't have to balance a huge bowl piled high with your noodles on top. Don't forget to add an egg. No extra charge! I also appreciate the meat isn't frozen so you can really smash a lot in your bowl. The bowls look small, but trust me, it's a lot of food.  I just wish their udon noodles were a little chewier, but they'll do. You can also choose white rice, fried rice, or even just cabbage.  Don't forget to sign up for their birthday club. You get a free regular sized bowl (they have a small so you are actually getting a medium), no purchase necessary!

YGN0GJFlSgJWChf4tD2iUA.text: I never tried this place but I recently got a $9.99 coupon for a regular bowl and drink. Figured I'll try it out. I made a bowl with chicken, broccoli, pineapple, corn, a few spices with fried rice, with no sauce. I'll say I was very disappointed in the taste. The meat was tough, fried rice was bland and dry. The food is cook on a black top which transfers a black burnt taste and smell. I tried it once and one time is enough for me to not go back again. I ate half the bowl and threw the other half in the trash. The staff was very helpful and polite to me. I'm not trying to be negative but just honest in my opinion. Two thumbs down.

l-Dh4j_PzOu9f49zWUz_YA.text: Used to be ok, tried tonight and they stopped the  all you can eat.  So in other words you pay what a buffet costs and can only tty one thing. Pass.   At least until they change back to the original model.

nZrTqy_8pbWymrRuIWF3ew.text: My server made the experience awesome... food was absolutely delicious. Definitely will make a return trip.

kydV_yx45zunDJx81dRPVg.text: We were greeted by an oldish white lady in her 50's or 60's with an attitude problem as soon as we walked in. She said 'right this way' and I politely asked if my wife and I could sit outside. She seemed to have a huge problem with it, stating that the side door wasn't open.  I have no idea what 'the side door wasn't open' even mean't. She told us to go on ahead and she would follow... I hadn't been to this location, so it took us a while to find the gate around the corner. She kinda just followed us from a distance. Horrible woman who sounded like she really didnt want to work there.  The food was nice, a little too much oil used to cook the stir fry, but it was nice. Next time I'll remember to ask them to cook with less oil, I hadn't been here before, so I didnt know the drill!   The service was probably the worst experience I have ever had in Las Vegas though and first impressions are everything. It was nice, but we wont be coming back!

AhWmah5EswDx009Mb1ojJg.text: No longer all you can eat for a prefix price bad health inspections in the past. Won't be back.

0CTCbcN4AmaSTMNuxx3epQ.text: Loved this place their first year.  I keep going back hoping for what we loved at first but it's just not there.  No more shrimp or shelled edamame to add to your bowl.  Prices are ridiculous for less than what they used to give.  The only reason to go these days is the cool Coke machine.  It's right next to the Sunset Station who has a better mongolian grill and you get the whole buffet for less than what these guys charge.  Wish you'd stayed as good as when you opened.

s9MeBdsqkvq_VoccOZD4sA.text: Servers are easily destracted. Our server had 3 tables including us and looked to be sweeping the floor across the way. Slow refills on drinks and when I finally asked for our check, she could be seen in the back office room munching out on her own dinner. My bowl items were not well mixed when cooking and I got a bite of nothing but a ball of sauce! We are done and left our "rewards" card on the table, they always forget to put points on it anyways. done.

OZDold1faX3z9b7EczVNVQ.text: Ok, I will try to make this painless. If you have never been to a mongolian rest, your missing out. Genghis is trying to be a bit to advanced and I think thats where they went wrong. First of all, I am in charge of what my food will taste like so I can't be upset with the flavor. That being said, my food was delicious haha. The ordering part is what drove me crazy. They have some knock off tablet at each table for you to enter your order in, opposed to the convenentional waiter or waitress asking you for your order. Well, we tried two different tablets and both didn't work. Feeling bad for the waitress as she tried so hard. I don't understand why you have a waitress enter your orders in on a tablet when she could do it herself in half of the time. Give you an A for effort but a C- for execution at best. I don't want to do any work when I go out to eat, if I did I would cook at home.

Kos04i6B3_9NoOnGGT0poA.text: The service was fine, we had a nice waitress that kept our drinks full. For the price I thought it was a pretty small bowl, and it just seems like a game they are playing. You get this small silver cat dish and when they serve it ,it comes in a large red funky shaped bowl. As if no one can figure that out.   The fried rice looked ok, the noodles were disgusting. I should have refused to eat them as they made my stomach upset later in the day. Very, very greasy, sauces were sugery.  They have calories on the wall and I have a sneaking suspicion they are very misleading and the calorie count is probably without the carbs and sauces....  This place is run in a guise of hoping we don't notice we are being treated like knuckleheads sardined in for an 8.99 bowl of goo. The cat dish is what? to prompt you to what upgrade to a second bowl of goo?   Yes, the tables were small, there was 4 people in my party and I was afraid to move my elbow.  The bill was 45 bucks without tips. ( you get reminded to tip too via signs)... For that amount of money  you are better off going to the Great Greek On Warm Springs and you can eat off their family meal for a few days. By the way two people in the party were hungry later on in the day.. so after spending so much on lunch they weren't even full... seemed extra expensive on that note....     I was disappointed with the overall experience. It wasn't a total bust but I would not go back unless someone else wanted me to go. In short too much work and aggravation. Getting your own food, squeezing in and out of the tables, and too little of it for the price once you consider tax and tip.

A_ieMSmUyiybJD4uRsCEjg.text: The server Brett was AWESOME!!! the restaruant is a little like a maze.. The food was really good. Picky eaters would be happy here. They have a huge variety and the food is plentiful. They even have wonderful suggestions.Also, it's user friendly.

JaOSCwkGJ0Xu8tFfvGgXJQ.text: Initial Impression and experience: So I have always loved Mongolian BBQ. I've dined at many in CA over the years, and this is the first one I've been to here in NV. When we walked up we were greeted outside the door and followed in to be seated right away. That was nice. We were sat at a table and told out waiter would be right with us. He came over and asked if we had ever been there. We said no, so he explained how it all works. Pretty easy to figure out, but whatever, we listened anyway. We got up and went to the food counter. All the food looked fresh and crisp. It was a little difficult to reach some of the items in the back because of the very low sneeze guard. The bowl they give you is VERY small, so everything you try to overstack falls off  :/ We watched them cook our food for a minute, and they came over to let us know our appetizer was on the table for us. So we went over to sit and eat.  Service: Service was on the a lot to be desired side. We each had a drink and they never refilled them for us. They actually took my boyfriends cup (like they were going to refill it) but never brought it back. They listened to my 13 year son over me on whether or not he was going to get all you can eat and brought him a second bowl to fill up anyway. I had to again tell them no, we are not getting all you can eat.  Food: The food was fresh and very good sauces and spices were available.  Price: TOO EXPENSIVE. There were 3 of us and we each got 1 bowl, an appetizer to share, and each a drink and we spent over $50. Too much to pay if you don't even end up with some left overs to take home. The price would have been fine if it was all you can eat that we did, but not for 1 tiny bowl.  Overall: We enjoyed the food a lot, but there wasn't enough and it was too expensive. I would go back, but not for the price. Like another person said, it's almost double what you would pay in CA for the same thing. You can even get close to this same type of food at any buffet here is Vegas and pay less, but have other options as well. I really liked the food and would love to go back, but only if they drop their prices.

3A0tCHHhPbDFSrA-gCKGig.text: This place is great and allows you to eat what you like and as much or little as you would like. I love this place and frequent it often. Great for large parties

MTCpxmBUNTCZ5nYNC-WxVQ.text: I REALLY, REALLY, REALLY, wanted to like this place. Let's start w the positive. Nice atmosphere, liked the bar and the fact that we could get mixed drinks, great staff! VERY friendly and helpful! Definitely the best looking Mongolian place I've been to. Unfortunately you can not eat all the above! If so it would be a 5 star joint. The food... Well it's hard to explain but it's not Mongolian BBQ. If they'd have left the mongolian out of the name and just called it Genghis Grill Stir fry, maybe I'd feel different. I just expected real Mongolian. I know it's a chain restaurant and you can tell they spent some dough in this place. But how do you screw Mongolian up? It's like these cats way over thought the concept? The meat was not good. The veggies combos were all wrong. And the sauces, which a prob the most important part were to thick! Way to thick. I don't care about the metal bowls and the cooks banging the gong when tipped, all I wanted was some descent Mongolian. What they have is way over done corporate over americanized Stir Fry.  Apparently you can get fajitas though? All you can eat! What a joke!

46G2y3PRUIAPNHuCvvs9Gw.text: I agree, cafeteria style and they cram you into a fast food type of eatery but, the hostess did move us from the uncontrolled kid area to a quieter area.  Our server was friendly and gives you a tour for first timers.  Pile all you can into the bowl since it all shrinks down big time.  I thought I put cabbage in there.....where did it go?  Anyway I liked it all with your many choices of meats, veggies, spices, and sauces.  So each time it's a different experience of flavor.  Of course their tea is freshly brewed.... A huge shout out to that!  We will definetly start this place into our rotation of frequent places to eat.

0HWasTxAi6joL-BghRGQHw.text: Good quality of food, and very kid friendly. A little pricey, which explains why it isn't 5 stars. Great fire show! My son loved it when they cleaned the grill. The portions are somewhat smaller than I expected. To be quite honest, the whole process of getting your food is a little confusing. I don't like the idea of the public being able to touch their own raw meat for some reason. It grosses me out. All the same....it's adequate but not fantastic.

bYJcYn8oTGfcMG8_ei304w.text: Yum! This place is convenient because it's close to my house and it's also very good. You basically pick all the meat, veggies, and sauce you like and bring it over to get cooked. Food usually comes out fairly quickly. For the starch items, I like to do a combo of half fried rice and half udon noodles. It's usually more than enough food for me. Good stuff!

idZrUJ4lqRDd2KHtVdCpHQ.text: I've read the bad reviews from people who have actually eaten there, but I was another "walk-out" before trying. I knew there would be a problem when the server tried to tell me how simple it was. "Just pick your protein" she said several times.  Next she admonished to pile on the vegetables because they "shrunk down to nothing!"  So, I was handed this tiny bowl that had to accommodate both!  What should I do? The last time I had so much pressure was a Vegas timeshare presentation!  I had an idea, go with one of the bowl suggestions on the board behind me.  So I said to the kitchen helper, "make me a Korean Bowl, please."   Her reply was "you do that, the description of ingredients is only a guide."  My wife said, "ok, where's the scallops?"  That was when she was told they only had them at night.  Genghis Khan was a barbarian and True to its name, this place was pretty barbaric. Fortunately, we escaped with our lives!

S9-SXZvC_3McD57cKHYrvA.text: I have eaten at this location several times.  The food is delicious!  Well worth the price.  The daytime staff is great, but the evening staff is incompetent and lousy!!!

vs0CHb2qzAnlWC3PTcIydw.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant, we have gone there for years, starting in early 2000 in the Plano TX location, and through all the different changes they've tried it's still been my favorite. Today we went and it's the first time that I sincerely think we will never go back.  They changed their food service, they have 3 different sizes to choose from. Small, medium, large. The medium is the old style dish. We decided to try the large, it's barely larger then the medium bowl and it's $2 more. They no longer have all you can eat, we were told you can pay $5 to go back up. So now you pay more to eat less. I overheard the manager tell people these changes were for better customer service, to give ppl more options. No one but kids will eat the small, so who were the options for if you used to just be able to pay $2 extra for all you can eat? It's not for the customer experience, it's corporate greed at its finest.  Then they now give you paper cards to carry with you as you feel your bowl, to hand to the griller's. What am I supposed to do with the paper card while I'm trying to use both hands to hold my bowl and reach under sneeze guard for food to put in my bowl? Bad ideas, did anyone ever try these ideas out before implementation? Extremely disappointed that corporate greed to increase profits year over year is ruining this restaurant the same way it's ruined so many over the years.

zqt2Xmg319KiBIoBJahu5g.text: Here goes again, we tried the restraunt again. The first time we visited was disappointing. The gm contacted me after the visit and ask us to return I agreed, where normally I wouldn't!!! We gave another chance. This visit was a disaster too. However the Mgr on duty on the 03/19/15 did her job and addressed the issues. I ordered fried rice n not white rice, I hate white rice but enjoy the taste of fried rice. And the issue of the table that showed up about 15-20 min after we put or food up to be cooked, they got some of there food before we did!! Our last visit the mgr on duty did nothing about the issues then. This visit she did! High 5!!!!. The food is good the beer is cold, just not a place to visit with a large family or party.

Au9pS-L88j-vTIUCE5MHtQ.text: First time visitor. A friend recommended this place and it definitely did not disappoint. The food tasted so fresh and I was impressed by all the options. I went for lunch and the portion was just perfect. It's definitely not a cheap meal but I don't mind spending $15 on a quality lunch, so I felt I got my money's worth. I got the chicken and shrimp with tons of veggies and brown rice. Normally I'm hesitant to order brown rice at a restaurant but I gave GG a chance and it was perfection, not mushy or chewy. I added a little too much sauce though. A couple downsides... I don't like the seating arrangements. I felt like I was practically sitting with the table next to me. Also the pepper/onion mix was kind of frozen and almost out and I felt like I was digging it out so I had a lot of chunks instead of big pieces. The food station was also really messy. I also was worried about cross contamination because there were no staff members over seeing the food bar. I guess everything gets cooked but it still worries me. Overall I really liked this place and I'll definitely be back and recommend it to anyone looking for a fresh unique meal!

4fBMviTopdNxiyb6SrzJNQ.text: Really good, fast, and can be super healthy' or not.  Its a build it yourself place, so if you don't know what to make for yourself, ask.   Expected a fast food style place, definitely not, in a good way.

ogfs0dHcwcP9Rua5G-JpVQ.text: The food is really good and I like that you get to pick all your items. However, the bar sucks. Not only does it have slow service but they also give you barely any alcohol in your drinks and you could leave with a stomach ache from all of the mix they give you.

7lolsbBdkM7q80sFII6IYA.text: The food is alright... It seems like the food stations were unkept... They needed to add more items to the bowls

baRFdEh8soU5ODoEgMUjyg.text: I really dont see where these one and 2 star reviews are coming from. I eat out a lot due to my lifestyle and having no time to cook. Due to working out and keeping in shape I eat at Teriyaki Madness, Greens and Proteins and my favorite Genghis Grill. I come here 4 days a week and have never had any problems. Great A+service, I'm always welcomed once I come in, staff is always helpful and the General Manager Reagan is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. She goes above and beyond to make sure you have an enjoyable experience each time you visit. Its hard to find good healthy food on the go because this country has fast food places at every corner and the pricest are cheap. Normally trying to eat healthy cost you a lot of money. So instead of going to a fast food place and getting a fatting meal and a soda for $6-$7.00 why not come here a get a healthy meal and an unsweetned ice tea for a few dollars more. Where else in the valley can you go where you can put as much meat on your bowl as you can with no weight limit? I can get enough meat on one regular size bowl (there is a strategy to it) and I can get two feeling meals out of it.  There are plenty of meats to choose from, a lot of seasonings, vegetables are always fresh, plenty of sauces to choose from and at the end you can choose your starch.  It takes me about 4 minutes to complete my bowl and 15 minutes for them to cook it before I'm on my way to work. Teriyaki Madness is good but you can get burned out on it because its cooked the same way.  Teriyaki Madness used to be generous with their meet but as they expanded and are known there starting to get stingy. With Genghis Grill you control how your bowl is. If your on a low sodium diet you control the amount of seasoning you can put in it. If your tired of a sauce, there are plenty of others to try from so I never get burned out from eating there. I already have 10 free bowls. 80% of being fit is what your eating. You can work out all day but if your diet is wrong you wont see results. Life is fast paced nowadays and if you got kids at practice and your wife or husband works as well as you its hard to cook everyday. This is a great option if you live life on the go like me.

bxLmuJXZs5caUtjk5jE9_Q.text: My husband took me here for lunch. I loved it. You pick your bowl size, then fill it up with fresh raw meat, veggies, seasonings, and sauce. Take it over to be cooked and pick your side. Its fresh and perfectly flavored. It was so good, I couldn't stop eating. Can't wait to go back. Great service.

Rn8NpYBiE7nKHgS4Uw5wcg.text: I love coming here! Always fresh food and such a large variety of meats and veggies. Staff is so so. Not the best but definitely not the worst. Definitely has room for improvement. Sadly, this is their only location. Wish they had a few around town.   They have lunch special from 11-5pm mon-Friday!!

gDtrRjOEufGKkYRmLX550w.text: Love this place. The food and service is always great. Their food is always fresh and they cook it right in front of you. If you tip them they hit the gong and sing a quick song, it's pretty cool. Great food! Recommend this location!

EGI1VWzrXbMOdFU_WbCEYg.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. The food was good but the service was not. They had good quality meat and a lot of options but it took 40 minutes to get our first bowl. zBUBxsxgNc0W-4u0rWcuAA.text: Food is fine. You're kind of in control of your own destiny, if you create your own bowl. GnItIW8GdNTuvG7wPxYY0w.text: Hands down best meat "buffet" we've been to! We got two large bowls and had 2 full meals of leftovers for next day! Great deal and great place ! Super clean . Definitely coming back for next #takeoutfriday !

-MhjILGp8av2kGpS124SJQ.text: I've got to say, I was a bit hesitant to try this place even though it has been open for quite a while now.  I have either heard that people love it or that they have gotten food poisoning/diarrhea from it.  I fall, somewhere in the middle, yet closer to the loving it stage.    I like how you can pick any meat and vegetable that you want but can see how there can easily be some cross-contamination with the tongs.  It also took me awhile to get everything I wanted (because I wanted it all) and there wasn't a line.  I can easily see how it could take forever to get through that line.  It was rather quick though when we got it to the griller.    It was tasty.  I combined a lot of flavors and it still turned out pretty great!  I say definitely go and try it.  You will get a lot of food for not too much money.  I was lucky enough to have bought a Groupon so I saved even more.  The desserts looked great but I didn't try any.  Lastly, my stomach was fine after but within an hour or so, maybe longer, it definitely began to rumble and continued for a good portion of the day so beware!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. My regular bowl with a myriad of meats and veggies atop soba noodles.  Quite tasty and a good amount of food.

P5acRy0jMMYFDnmAnpSY2w.text: Great food and friendly service, but it can be pricey if you're not a regular. By this I mean building bowls there is an acquired skill; I can stack a medium to become a large, or a small to a medium because of the number of times I've visited. Unfortunately I've seen newcomers order a large and put so little food in it because they're scared to overstack. If you're going for the first time remember to stack as high as you can, make a mountain.

wNnxyzpdgONVOAWLbZ7OUg.text: We have always loved going to Genghis Grill but recently our experiences have been much better than usual due to the service of our waiter Jakov (not sure on the spelling but that's a close as I can get)  He is a wonderful waiter and treats us like royalty, refilling our drinks for us, boxing up our leftovers and frequently checking back to make sure eventing is great. The past 2 times we have visited Genghis, Jakov has made our dinner and time together much more enjoyable, because we didn't have to worry about a single thing, we knew that Jakov would come by and make sure everything was well.  We highly recommend Genghis Grill to everyone, the food is fresh and tastes great, the atmosphere is friendly and relaxed, and if you're lucky enough to get Jakov to be your waiter, then you'll have an extra special visit, for sure!   Genghis Grill gets 5 stars Jakov gets 10 stars, he is quite terrific!

3WMdqGRXksPubNZU2d0uyg.text: This place was was so good. The waitress told me and my family "don't be shy and top off your bowl as high as you can". F-f9iEEAh30NJOp7Lj1XGw.text: Having used to go to a GG in AZ all the time, we are happy to have one near us in NV now. We have visited this location twice now in the past few weeks. Our server was the same girl who actually remembered us, and was pleasant both visits. Haven't had any problems over there and it's been delicious.

rXlRwp4-7P91NA28_GvRbg.text: YUMMY! first time i've been here and i'm so glad i did! upon walking in, the restaurant is nice and clean and the staff are extremely welcoming! my friends and i were seated pretty quickly and the server came and explained to us how it works.  so you're given three sizes, a small, medium or a large. you're then given a bowl and a receipt and you walk up to a salad bar-ish place where you pile on your proteins, veggies, and sauce. the meats and the veggies look fresh and some of the meats even has marinade in it already! there as an option of chicken, shrimp, pork and beef- lots of pick from!! plus side of this is they have the calories on the tag as well for people who are calorie conscious! then you walk up to the chefs, pick your grains or noodles, hand them your receipt and then they cook it for you and deliver it to your table!  i like this place because if you're on a low carb diet, you can still make it work to your benefit and if you're on a paleo diet, it still works as well since you get to choose what goes in your bowl! my friends and i got the large and it is enough to take home! wayyyy better than other fast food chinese/mongolian places since you control what goes in your bowl.   all in all, i am going to come back here again when i'm craving chinese/mongolian food!!

vDBNid7sZ87MON1K-WIU2Q.text: The set up is interesting, the staff is young and are doing pretty good. This place upon intial entry, you question if they are real. However...  The good is awesome. You pick it they cook it a d there IS an art to stacking your bowl. Here's a hint,  Meat on bottom, veggies on top, spinach very very last. Lol  Have fun!

EM31Hri5EryCnF3BJpYkJA.text: We love eating here!!! The food is delicious, options are great and the service is wonderful. I've never had a bad experience and I've been going here for over 3 years. We live all the way in Summerlin and we try to make the trek over to Henderson at least once a month just to eat here.

aI8StTD2LULT1h_ndrJo0A.text: Went here yesterday for lunch. It was pretty good even though I wasn't fully impressed. I really wish they offered salad bar and all you can eat. Most Mongolian stirfry places I've been to in the US offer that. The bowls are extremely hard to fill and I can honestly say I left hungry. Please add salad bar and all you can eat. Also sour cream if offering tortillas.

G7bsqtaOTWBUeTS_Xe_r2A.text: Great food. Good selection and good service. I like the concept of how everything is set up. But..... they have the absolute worst smelling restroom I've ever smelled in my life. Literally worse than an out house. They appear clean, so I have no idea what the smell could be.

QQu3gCJFVm4Ps7Lv0U8Fkg.text: You can make you own bowl here. They offer many different types of meat and veggies. I ordered a big bowl. It is totally enough for two meals. It is interesting and worth a try

iq9iNBPSFzg1-cFFN4xNiw.text: You design your own plate here at the Genghis Grill so it's hard to rate it on it's food. So instead I must base my review primarily on the service, which is fantastic. Everyone here was very helpful and the food was very reasonably priced. Not overly crowded during prime lunch hours but a steady stream of customers came through while I ate and each was taken care of in a very timely and professional manner. I recommend asking your waiter for suggestions on building your own bowl as it is very easy to mess up an otherwise delicious dish with what you think would be a good mix. I experienced that myself the first time I was here with a sausage and Crab fried rice that tasted like nothing but sausage and soy due to me adding too much of each. Great little gem of a restaurant, highly recommend.

3PVl0oFoY_a-l1tTTi8yvA.text: I made a pretty positive review prior and was pretty happy. I went back to get another bowl cuz I was craving it and I can honestly say I am a little annoyed with this place this time. I put madarin oranges in my bowl both times I have come cuz I like the sweet with the spice I put in, and both times they have been removed from my bowl. Why do you offer them if you are just going to remove them? I also requested both udon noodles and fried rice....no rice at all, both times I have been here, and very little noodles. So admittedly, although I like this place and think it is good, I was not as happy this time. Especially when I came in and expected to pay lunch time prices and paid dinner prices instead even though it was about 11 something when I went.

aiwF_XddrUrLXcglcwr-vQ.text: I love the food here and was pleasantly surprised to see the shrimp is back during dinner. However, the men's bathroom smells like a hot fart on a humid day. It's been at least two years and they haven't bothered to fix it. Use some of the money from raising the prices and fix the plumbing.

XyPDq_5yy3bnhs1Sz0YZWw.text: Food is great , love how you can make your own plate . The only thing that I didn't like was the bathroom , unpleasant odor .Would give 5 star but just because of the bathroom odor only 3 stars

COKYna_J3IzE2xhoKJb_8Q.text: This is my Husband's favorite spot. It's a bit pricey, but worth it. Genghis is a Mongolian grill. They give you a bowl to stack all your items in. You start with your protein: they have chicken, turkey, pork, beef, sausage, ham, shrimp, fish, crab, scallops, and pepperoni. Then you spice your protein. They have all kinds of spices. Everything from salt to ginger. Next you pick your veggies and wow do they have veggies!! All the things sprouts, peppers, potatoes, tofu, onions, eggs, mushrooms..ect. Now it's time to pick your sauce. They again have several to pick from: they have a honey soy, their signature sauce called 3G sauce, a spice sauce called Dragon sauce. It also tells you the heat level on them. Now you go over to the grill where the chef will ask you to pick your starch. They have brown rice, white rice, fried rice, udon noodles (my favorite) , spiral noodles and tortillas. Now they take ALL your things and cook it on a huge flat top grill! You can stand and watch or sit at your table. If one bowl just isn't enough for you they also have a bottomless option for a few bucks more.  They have a full bar or you can get your own drinks at their super cool coke freestyle machines. You can mix any flavor and soda you want. Plus unlimited refills.   Genghis also has appetizers and desserts, but I've never tried them. I always see people order the pot stickers.   A cool thing about Genghis is they have table side ordering system. Each table has a little computer where you can place your order and pay! It's very convenient.   Their staff is nice and friendly, but if your in a hurry this is not the place to go. It can take some time to get your bowl if there are a lot of people there. Overall no real complaints. The food is yummy and it's fun to pick all the things that go in your meal. Also, very healthy and a great place for kids. On Tuesday's kids eat free with an adult. Plus, on your birthday you get a birthday bowl for free if you join their email club.

jV_ec3ARpKn6Jsu0AQJArg.text: This place deserves better rating. It's rly nice place with great food and good service, for the price its 5stars.

p__acn8xN3H-P8VDYZ-A8g.text: Great place to eat and chill for a little. Seevice was fast and a very friendly staff plus great food.  Area clean and music wasn't over bearing and facility was very clean.  I will be xoming back

2lT5P7QIdQIg8oW93vii2Q.text: Idea of this restaurant is great but could be organized differently for efficiency. When cooking several bowls, burnt black pieces are all over the last bowls. Fried rice was dry and flavorless

4gRpIHPMfynnbLN9BwrYMg.text: Used to like coming here. Every time i'm on this side of town i'd make plans to stop for lunch. Never had an issue. This current visit was sad. My husband and I each ordered rice for our starch and there was only HALF of what we were used to getting. The portion was so small that we left hungry. When we asked a server what was up with portion sizes she said people had been complaining that there was too much starch. Huh? Too much? Well now theres not enough to even fill up a normal person!   I doubt we'll be back   At this point i'd rather frequent green valleys buffet for Mongolian bbq.

zYyK-5spyQtLFVERQcxuOw.text: Totally love their fun mongolian establishment! It is self serve, but they've got all the cool stuff, and an extensive selection of ingredients to choose from! So much you'd be so undecided on what to choose. So...after coming here a few times already, here's my advice:  1.) THE DREADED SILVER PLATE: They give you a silver plate which looks really small and depressing because halfway through filling your silver plate with stuff, you realize that the silver bowl is wwwaaaaayyyy too small, and you'll learn that really quick once you get your cooked food since they all shrink down to size after being cooked. MY SUGGESTION: pile high. no joke. PILE HIGH. don't be shameful. don't second guess. Yess....this is your game of jenga or tetris with food. Pile as high as you can. If you have to smush with your hands do it (it's not a crime to pile high nor is it a crime to take your time, people can go around you...).   2.) TASTE TEST YOUR FLAVORS! You can taste as much sauces as you'd like, and you can mix them. If you're not sure try them, and! The fun labels tell you EXACTLY what it pairs well with.   3.) INDECISIVE? DON'T KNOW WHERE TO START? No worries, in the beginning of the line they have fun recipe cards you can use and to help you start so then if you're looking to put in your flavor...you can play around with it. Think of it as an inspiration card.  4.) CHOOSE YOUR STARCH: I usually go with the brown rice. I love that that they have brown rice and I'm sure you healthy eaters will too. Think it's not enough? You can request for double!  5.) SELF SERVE COKE MACHINE: High five selling coke products, but even more of a high five for having that cool new digital coke machine! Mix and match every flavor known to man! You'll be sure to be indecisive in a drink here too.  6.) SUPER COOL TOUCH PAD: Here, you can split your tap with your lunch date and fun touch pad games while waiting.  **I love that this brings an opportunity to just get creative. You can be really interactive with it.  It does get busy during lunch, and the wait does take some time, so if you're in during your lunch break, expect that your meal won't come out in time for you to get back to the office.

iniXMsE7BP7NdxTcrOmhIg.text: They recently made some changes and it stinks. They have different and less options than last time. The sizes and prices of their bowls are kind of a joke. Not sure if I will return. The staff is overwhelming.

r4n6iNICsY35nn0cOH2qjw.text: Not your typical Mongolian Grill, this place is great, why? Because you make the menu! They have a wide array of items to put in your bowl. Well that sounds quite typical of a Mongolian Grill! I heard someone say. Ok so here is the not typical part: They have things not normally found at a Mongolian Grill such as Pepperoni! I should also mention the incredible selection of sauces. They also have a great loyalty club! Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

njcMyKbukKTHhg4wlaInUg.text: I see all these bad reviews and I am wondering if I went to the same place!?! I mean, its create your own bowl, if you don't like it, it's kinda YOUR OWN FAULT!  Ok so this is a Mangolian style bbq place where you load up your raw ingredients and then give it to a chef to cook. The options are endless. Chicken, steak, pork, ham, sausage, turkey, fish, shrimp, calamari, crab (imitation), and I am sure I missed something. Then you hit veggies. Stir fry, classic, pretty much everything you could think of. Then sauce. Kung Pao, Teryiaki, Curry, sweet, spicy, you name it! I think there are 8 different ones. You also have numerous spices, and herbs to add. If you can't decide, there are recipe card suggestions like Firecracker shrimp, Teriyaki Bowl, and Kung Pao chicken. For $11.99 you can fill your bowl once, if you are still hungry, add $4 for AYCE. Pile your bowl high because the veggies do decrease when they cook. Also, there are 3 appetizers. Lettuce wraps, edamame, and pot stickers. I prefer the potsticker, cooked well.  They have a full bar that I have yet to take advantage of. The servers don't do much, but they are always treating us like gold. Until this place shows a bad health grade, I will continue to be a regular here.

6AVmGfMhqtUhk-qYNBPpBQ.text: I love this great Mongolian grill restaurant. The service is friendly. I love how you can get three options like Udon noodles or brown rice and you can add an egg. They have a good selection of vegetables, meats, seafood and spices. The only bad thing is that I wish they had little recipes to make customized sauces. Love how these bowls taste. Be careful of what size you get since you add three options, you'll fill up quicky with noodles and brown rice.

a1OvdxLzXc70hFQ0hCDNRA.text: Good food, it's like a subway but for Asian food. One of the greatest things about subway is your ability to indulge exclusively to the level of your dietary comfort, Ghengis Grill accomplishes the same feat.  Where it goes one step further is by giving you literally. Ever. Option. Under. The. Sun. You can build a bowl comprised of a gigantic plethora of vegetables and beans; any assortment or amount of seafood, meat, poultry, and tofu (depending on the day); coated in an exponential combination of seasonings and flavors; and seated atop a bed of any common carb source you could want. It's impossible to leave without having eaten what you wanted to eat. The restaurant is fantastic.  The staff is extremely friendly, and truly welcoming. Unfortunately their prices are not; their are deals depending on the day (and your birthday :D) but for a healthy casual place to eat it's terribly overpriced. Additionally, I have seen similar franchises which offer the same experience but with unlimited bowls, for a cheaper price. This restaurant should just commit and make themselves a competitive contender for the average persons choice in a casual meal.   This reviewer suggests you grab a date or fly solo, and explore your palette on a delicious feast.

JZ1XUqPuLlRw4IHSe60Vuw.text: Last night a few of us went to Genghis after work to have some Mongolian BBQ and drinks.  It was Friday, a long week and we deserved it!  If you look at my last update, you'll know that this place has a lot to choose from.  This time, I decided to get the bottomless dinner bowl for $13.99.  I tried getting the Udon noodles on my first bowl and wasn't impressed.  The noodles didn't take much of the flavor I hoped it would.  Got the fried rice in my second bowl and I was a happy camper.  Love putting pork and shrimp in there, plus a lot of texture, like bamboo shoots, water chestnuts and other crunchy veggies.    At the end of my meal, I had to try the molten lava cake with ice cream for $4.99.  It was a light and fluffy cake, filled with fudge.  If you get this dessert, I would recommend adding the ice cream in to bring another flavor to the chocolate.  All in all, it was was great dessert and a great way to end my dinner there.  Last night was a wonderful time.  Great company, good food and great service!  Janean was our server and she was super attentive and funny as heck.  I know that the table next to us didn't have a great time with her, but I never judge the service by someone else.  Everyone has their own levels of service expectations and mine includes forgiveness.  With Janean though, there were no red flags and I truly appreciated her calling us by our first names at all times.  I have a great appreciation for this place and I know that you will too!  Be sure to stop by and get some Mongolian goodness!

vlA7p0uxQN-FjY4rYKQFbA.text: We took my mom here for her BDay and Danielle was awesome as usual, I just love this place!!! Food was/is awesome as usual.....this is what Danielle fixed for my mom and it was so good!!!!

WP278ZU9EpBIP5od81ylMw.text: I love this place. This is the second time my fiance and I have been here. I love the build your own bowl and how they are attentive. We tried the chicken pop stickers as an appetizer and they were very very good. Thanks to our waitress who recommended them. I also love the fact that you can have all you can drink soft drinks. I prefer the Ice Tea. It is so fresh and refreshing. I would recommend this place for lunch or even a Date night. They also have a bar and my fiance had the Long Island Ice tea and it was good! We will be back. They also do take out in case you just want to pick up a bowl to go. You can build your won to go!

ngnZb8JR-1pbNIOTA91uLQ.text: The first thing that stood out as soon as I entered this establishment was the fact that it was empty. The waitress came to our table and immediately hounded us with questions. We weren't even sitting yet! She also brought along 9 bowls with her in 3 varying sizes. She wasn't wearing any gloves, and the bowls were not on any trays. She asked us for our name and bowl size and then handed each of us a card and a bowl. I have been to two different Genghis in AZ so I found this particular practice odd and off putting. I am used to going to the food area and being handed there a bowl on a tray from someone wearing gloves. Also keep in mind that she brought 9 bowls and there were only 3 of us.. I can only assume that those remaining 6 bowls would be carried back to where ever she got them and used later because I certainly can't see them throwing those 6 bowls in the wash. Especially if this is the normal practice each time a customer comes in.. That would be a lot of unused bowls to be washed. So imagine how many times those unused bowls go back and forth between tables and how many times the waitress has to touch them (without gloves) and how many different waitresses end up touching the same bowl. Very unsanitary! This little practice alone caused us to leave and I am so glad I did. On the way out I noticed that they had a C grade! When there is raw meat sitting out, a C grade is very scary.

GnUvO0DaPmHZIEz8v47LOQ.text: After seeing this place on the news last night  me and my wife decided to have lunch here today. When we arrived we were asked if this was our first time here and we informed the waitress it was she and the rest of the staff walked us thru on how to build our bowls and sauces. I don't really remember our waitress's name or the manager's name I was happy with our meals. We will definitely be back soon

O4GcMVOUKuOw56Qby-QC6w.text: So you go through the usual buffet kind of line to fill your bowl and then give it to the cook at the end.   The problem: There is no one tending the "buffet" and almost every thing was empty.  The chicken and beef bins were empty.  There was plenty of ham and pepperoni (what?).  The broccoli, bean sprouts, baby corn, onion and tofu bins were also empty.  We complained about it, and the staff said sorry, but did not do anything about it.  Boooo.

yApe7tegtPcMM7SYmGmUeg.text: Love Mongolian BBQ, Love this place.  Everything is always fresh and has the best varitey of any I have been to.  Would have given it 5 stars if they had the traditional sesame and other cool oils....

jphDg4l9iZO-RoBR_s9jYg.text: Genghis Grill usually has good food for very expensive prices. The service is usually lackluster, and don't make the servers mad. Last time I went and asked for a new server, she went back to the cooks and told them to spit in my families food (the cooks told us after). Good food, but be careful

T2xMs16kh4EO0WD3N_CfLA.text: Mongolian BBQ Time As my husband woke up today one of the first things out of his mouth was "I'm hungry"! I responded with we have this and we have that...but nothing was going to satisfy his craving except some mongolian bbq. I haven't ate any mongolian bbq in years, mainly because of food crossing other food. So, if you have any food allergies this could be dangerous. But my issue is with sesame seed oil, its a big trigger for my migraines. And being 8 months pregnant, well...I could go without the hassle of a migraine! As you could imagine my excitement about lunch was that of going to the doctors, but I sucked it up with a smile on my face. As we walked into Genghis Grill we were greeted by the friendly staff. The place was clean and had a good atmosphere. Our server was nice and showed us how to build the bowls. She also asked if we had any allergies...so nice to know that they care about their customers. I was amazing at how organized and clean the food station was. The meat, vegetable, spice and sauce assortment was amazing, way better then any other mongolian bbq I've been too before! You have the choice of creating your own mix or taking a recipe off the wall. I chose shrimp, fish, cabbage, pineapple, mushroom, tomatoes, green & red peppers, bamboo shoots, snow peas and some great sauces! A little tip, press the vegetables down as you add more, otherwise you won't be able to fit everything you want in the bowl! When we got to the grill, the cook asked again if we had any allergies! Wow, thank you so much for asking that Genghis Grill grill cook!!! The grill cook will also ask if you want steamed rice, brown rice, noddles, spiral noddles or tortillas shells. I love all the different varieties of this place! As we sat and waited for our food, it gave us a better chance to look over the menu. They have appetizers, desserts and a nice selection of beverages. By the time I was done reviewing the menu, the server brought us our food. Be fore warned...food is very hot when it comes off the grill!! I burnt my tongue, so don't be tempted to dig right in! After my tongue felt better and the bowl cooled off, I was able to taste my creation. Mine was delicious and my husband said his was pretty good as well! For an extra few dollars you can make your bowls unlimited, not that you really need too! Mine was filling enough but my husband had to try it again! After finishing my bowl and watching my husband eat his second, I decided to try some of their desserts. A nice piece of pineapple cake. This was no ordinary pineapple cake, it had layers of cake and a type of cheese filling layers with a piece of pineapple in the middle. It was super yummy and the side of vanilla ice cream it came with, only made it that much better!! So, as an over all experience...I'd say...I'll be back soon to eat more!! If you are lucky enough to have one of these in your area and you haven't tried it yet, you should! You don't know what your missing!! inapplesworld.blogspot.c...

KQjHRdC-fGFyfke3nF7fxw.text: We've now been to this restaurant 4 times and it just stays fairly bad. We've talked to management and get excuses and statements like, "oh, we're just really busy", "we're still training", etc. The quality of the ingredients is really good and the service is pretty good, too. Where this place falls down is the cooking. They just can't seem to get the concept that the bowls need to be placed on the grill in the order they arrive and come off in that order, too. Three of the four times we've been I've had burnt food because the cooks are standing around talking or horsing around lighting the grill. If you've ever been to a real Mongolian BBQ I think you will be disappointed in this place. We're hoping somebody recognizes the potential and opens up a good one!

d5cQrLY8tFtxuVkQd3rPTg.text: Really great place. We have eaten there about 4 times now.  It's a fun place and the food is really good.  Reasonably priced too!

zdFjK6q14QaV7eii_ionAg.text: I was so excited to try this place out, I'd heard nothing but good things about it from friends in other cities. Sadly, I was a bit disappointed.   First off, the tables are WAY TOO close together, and some are placed in the most awkward and ridiculous spots. So we sat down, ordered an appetizer, and then got our instructions to fill our little bowl up at the bar with meats and veggies. I thought this would be a fun experience, it was not. We started with the meats, which were completely raw. I know it gets all cooked together, but just the thought of it and the fact that the raw meat is so close to the other food items just irked me out.  So I put some raw chicken and raw steak bits in.  They tell you at the beginning to "load it high" with veggies but it just becomes annoying as you make this little mountain of veggies that keep toppling all over the place, not to mention the glass casing makes it nearly impossible to grab veggies from the other side..ugh it was just annoying.  Then we get to the sauces, which like others have said, look like all the same high fructose corn syrupy goodness. We chose our starch (I got brown rice, my friend got noodles) and went back to our table.    The bowls came out fairly quickly, yet still no appetizer.  The appetizer finally showed up when we had nearly finished...I almost wanted to ask if the server could just take it back.  Anyhow, the food was meh.  I tried my friend's noodles and they were absolutely awful, please don't opt for those. They were flavorless and a strange consistency.  I feel like I could make the same dishes at home fairly easily and much much healthier.    One last thing, when we got our bill, we noticed it had charged us the price for the "unlimited" bowls, when we'd each had just one. We asked the server about this and she said that that's the only way the bowls are charged, but pointed out a credit at the bottom where we were each credited $2 for not doing the unlimited. Seems like a strange, unnecessary way to do the billing (??).  I don't think I'll be back here, if I want a healthy bowl of rice, chicken, and veggies I can just make it at home.  If I want an authentic Mongolian BBQ, I'll go anywhere else.

lXXkwMPq9fboTxXThUnMgQ.text: friendly helpful staff. good quality food. fast efficient service. All the qualities you are looking for in a family friendly neighborhood restaurant. The perfect place for the family to dine after a day out at the soccer or baseball fields, so take a break from the pizza joints and visit a restaurant that is truly unique.

enenwa31-tUOy5jtF1lv_Q.text: We took the whole family, 11 of us, ranging from four years old to high 80s. Alyssa gave us the best service ever. Everything was delicious,  and the service was prompt, officiant, and friendly.

d2AYR9AUsz5KwG2D-ullCg.text: I have eaten at this location and the two different locations in Reno many, many, times over the last few years.  I have recommended Genghis to many of my friends as well.   I used to love the food.  Over the years they have made several changes which I have disliked.  They no longer have shrimp.  They used to have steak....they changed it to steak tips.  They have raised the price, and changed it to different sizes.   Through all of that I continued coming.     I just finished my final experience here.   I have had some minor issues with the service before,  but, generally everyone has been friendly.   Tonight, despite their friendliness, I stormed out.  After you finish your first bowl your server comes over and asks if you want the ayce option.  If I am hungry I would prefer not to sit there and wait 15 minutes while my waitress is having a conversation at another table.  Especially while many other employees pass me by.   Funny thing is after about 10 minutes someone came by and said let me get that bowl out of your way( my original bowl)....but took off before I could even ask about another bowl.    I sat there and sat there and finally flagged down an employee and told her I was leaving what I thought would be enough for my food, beverage, and tax.  ($15).  I might have overreacted and could have been more patient,  but there were like 4 tables going in the whole place.   Sick thing is I work in the service industry, and I don't even mind that my waitress was having a conversation.....just hold up on it for a quick second to come over and approve my second bowl....then go right on back.   I was very surprised to see so many poor reviews piling up for this place, but I guess I understand why now.

2hGwqV3n4e60oaXeQVzlXg.text: Very unique atmosphere love the idea of creating your own stir fru, I love that I can choose my food and not be picky per snicktie  on what I love in my stir fry jalapenos onions bell peppers chicken and siracha brown rice, I love my options  I need the siracha chicken was best texture and flavor I have tasted in my option the spicy flavor came after which was ok, the staff was friendly and well mannered clean environment  Thank you very much excellent great delicious food

5G15UxYb1-xm6JBmIbsz_A.text: Omg, this is my favorite place to eat! The staff is always friendly, the food is always great and the prices are totally reasonable. There are so many options to eat and the customization is great. I love it here.

_iSzwJOuYjK9-SLeJqodMw.text: I wish they didn't close the one location we have in Illinois. I love this place for the variety. You are your own chef. You choose your own ingredients, so only you can really mess it up!

dC2FId8xQ9ALECMG8MAqFw.text: Awkward is the best way to describe the servers and the expectations of a tip by the servers when they did nothing except bring a bowl to my table. The system needs to be fixed. Even refills on the drinks are self serve, yet the servers expect a 20% tip.   On the good side , the food was good and was cooked correctly . Just hating feeling uncomfortable when I tip as though it's s buffet 1 or 2 bucks a person and having to worry next time I go in there the way I am viewed.

2FzYQ_tVOllhtwR1KBObMQ.text: Big disappointment & an even bigger ripoff -  $68 for limp, overlooked edamame, 4 medium sized bowls & 4 drinks is ridiculous. Especially when the food you end up with isn't even that good. I've been to many good Mongolian BBQ places & unfortunately, this wasn't one.  My hubby & youngest son had been there before & liked it, my oldest son & I had not.  1st disappointment was that they were out of shrimp. I was trying to build a variation of their firecracker bowl which has shrimp, calamari & scallops in it so that was annoying. The guy just said they weren't carrying shrimp anymore. Really? Maybe they shouldn't have shrimp listed on their menu as an option then.  Something else to note, not a disappointment, but def another annoyance.. It was extremely difficult to reach the food bins in the very back row bc the sneeze guards are so low. I'm not short nor do I have short arms.. 5'10" & I'm sure I looked ridiculous trying to reach the veggies that I wanted lol Last but not least, I had to completely remake my bowl bc the 1st one was inedible. Well, actually my hubby remade it bc at that point, I was over the whole "experience" & just wanted to leave. The calamari rings were closer to rubber bands & the whole thing just tasted "off" Bad seafood-not good!

RY-ocmWOpnRG4koi_mHciQ.text: Love coming here from the time they open in Henderson. Food always comes out amazing and I always have leftovers for the next day.  Love making my own bowls of food. Sometimes it's a bit burn but it comes with the grilling.

gR7qW5UMygcYCKs4mEkdqA.text: I like this place.   I liked it better when we first found it and they still served shrimp.   Pros: make your own bowl, get your own drinks, no waiting for service if you don't order extras. mix and match meats, veggies, sauces, etc.   Cons: it is REALLY awkward to reach the items in the back row, based on how the "sneeze guard" is situated. They stopped serving shrimp. It gets really messy sometimes (possibly also due to the awkwardness reaching the back items). there isn't really much service if you don't order extras. we've had to ask for clean bowls multiple times when they were handed to us.   I will still go here, and I like it, but it's not a "must have" list.

n1D8mFDuaVuH6uZNhuwmQA.text: I took my teenage daughter here on a Saturday afternoon while we were running errands & was very pleased.  While I was familiar with the concept of Mongolian BBQ, she was not, so the waitress took her time explaining exactly what needed to happen.  I had to help out a little bit along the way, but the waitress (Kat?) was great.    We went down the food-bar making our bowls, and while yes, the silver bowls that they give you are pretty small, it's pretty easy to stack all of the things you want inside.  Personally, I ended up with a bowl of food that was bigger than I could eat, as did my daughter.  The choices were good, though there were a few things that I felt were missing.  I would have liked some better options in the produce, but it was still pretty good.  There were a LOT of protein options - steak, chicken, shrimp, sausage, etc.  I used marinaded steak and shrimp.  Sauces and spices - again a lot of options.  As I'd never been here, I wasn't sure what I wanted, but I pieced it together and was happy with the end product.  To top it off, your carb is separate.  While many places give you a bigger bowl, you often have to stuff your noodles in there as well as the meats and veggies.  Genghis doesn't do it that way.  When you give your bowl to the chef, you tell him which carb you want.  I went with the Udon and was happy to see that they were Udon noodles and not spaghetti noodles, like I sometimes see.  All in all, a good experience.  I'd like to go back again sometime for dinner & try the scallops.

ne0CZRja3FP-XwprcX-vFw.text: This place is amazing you get to pick you own everything. So picky or not your going to like it :) will definitely come back soon and often.
