When we went to go get the ingredients, the area where they had the meats and veggies. Was so disgustingly dirty like food everywhere and all messy. Some things not fully refilled. So gross. But we still gave it another chance. The food was just ok pretty sure it made us kind of sick afterwards.   Do not come here it's disgusting

aX0bfkLnrupQ0GO6Gvz8mw.text: First time here & my best friend & I loved it. We were a little scared at first because we didn't know how much to add of the meats, veggies, & seasoning, but our amazing server Andie walked us through the process! Will definitely return here again!

tPDLh3neT0mgUcRmswYVnw.text: Really, really good! We first walked in, and just stood there for a long time. Almost left, but they had just opened and we gave them time. Once we were seated, we met Mia. It was our first time there. We chose to make our own bowl. She walked us over, explained how it worked and let us loose on deciding what wonderful, fresh meat, veggies and sauces we wanted.   They have cards that offer suggestions on what to choose, or you can choose whatever sounds good. Get more veggies than you think...smashing it down in the bowl as you go along...as they cook down. I loved the idea of grabbing an egg so there would be scrambled egg in the mix, so don't forget to grab the egg along the way if that's what you like. Yum!  Really liked the experience. Mia checked back with us, as did the manager. Really loved the food! The service was great. We were really glad we didn't listen to the random bad reviews. This place is great.

sK60aA_Tbve1tWU85IUoBg.text: Food is good. Service is a little short on people and they forgot a lot of things. But still a great family establishment.

T4chaMB1ARQvSa9TnbDMHg.text: Was skeptical coming here the first time, but it was great! I came back twice in the week! You get to make your own portion & the price is great. Friendly staff as well.

tG0WTn9gs_PpuilrXaHbRw.text: Pretty much walked in, went thru the line and walked out. That place was gross, smelled like vomit and was extremely unsanitary. I knew I'd most likely get food poisoning if we stayed.   I've worked in the food industry and I've been to other Mongolian places but this was plain nasty. It was a salmonella nightmare.  They were out of chicken so the girl washing dishes right by it went to get more. Same plastic gloves from the washing, touching door handles, etc and they were so used up they were falling off her hands. Then she takes the tongs from the chicken vat, puts them on the countertop, uses her hands to smooth out the new chicken in the vat then with her slimy gloves, covered in raw chicken picks up the tongs and puts them back in the vat. The tongs were disgusting. We all used them and got raw chicken all over our hands. They were out of most things, nothing looked like it was refrigerated or maintained. The items are three deep and you need loooong arms so they probably get all kinds of debris in the open containers from ppl having to bend and stretch to reach in. Nothing on their side was covered with a sneeze guard or anything.   It was Sunday night around 6 pm. Place was pretty empty but the hostess still put our party of two RIGHT in the middle of a large group of people.   I know people love this place and have enjoyed many meals here without incidence but I was not going to take that chance. It takes a LOT for me to get grossed out by a restaurant. This is my first and probably only review. This place needs an intervention!  I've eaten tacos from roadside stands in Mexico and have never been grossed out like this. Spillage everywhere u looked. Dirty floors, tables, etc.  Yuck!

QNJk-vx_FZ-plFTtJRffVw.text: this place is for you if you like to build your own plate :). I usually get the medium bowl and always have left over to take home. it is Mongolian bbq style but everything you choose on meats, veggies, sauces and spices then they cook for you on the grill. it is fun because it is up to you on what you like on what it will taste like at the end. they are very careful with allergies so if you have some this will be the place to go try. the servers are very attentive and comes by and ask how everything is going which is awesome. The drinks are self serve you just go and get your drinks from the soda machine and they will charge accordingly. the special they are doing is 20 percent off appetizers and 2 or 3 dollar bottle beers which is nice. I never had bad experience here so bring your whole family and enjoy the food and atmosphere.

a5wAu6y1x364Wtf9QQ3kGg.text: We came to this place last Sunday for dinner and used a Groupon we had purchased.  It was our first time.  We are familiar with Mongolian BBQ as we have some excellent places near us.  This one was a little different.  Here, there are three sized to choose from.  I got the small, my husband and daughter got the regular size.  Here is the one exception I had with this place - the bowl that you fill up with meat and veggies was very small.  I prefer my meal to be mostly meat and veggies, with a small amount of rice or noodles.  I know I had the option of having cabbage as my base, but would have preferred just a bowl full of stir fried meats and veggies!  Still, the service was prompt and friendly.  My daughter found hers did not have enough sauce, and our server brought her additional warmed sauce.    We would return!

ij5MG27yq-r5eEFZP9gLVw.text: I can say I will not come back here.   It was an interesting experience, the service was not too great, I was not impressed. I had to make sure if an allergy and the person working there couldn't tell me much. It was difficult to "stack our bowls" because most of it just slid off. It took a long time to get our bowls, one of them came out late and burnt (the rest of the table was done eating already).   Needless to say, we should have chosen another place.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

YzBoWhy7Dfgn4uNQWpX5Mg.text: As solid a mongolian bbq as it gets.  All the fixins, a clean restaurant and friendly staff.  It's not a new concept but it has more options than I've seen at other similar places, especially when it comes to seafood.  I came here with a girlfriend for lunch and we were in and out in less than and hour (with at least half of that chit chatting like old girlfriends do).  They offer alcohol and I like that although you essentially make your food yourself, they've leaned toward a traditional restaurant setting where it's delivered to you and your drinks are refilled by a server.  It makes it less of a fast food feel, which I appreciate.  With that being said, don't forget to tip the servers.  They deserve and you'll thank yourself later.  Or at least karma will. I love that you have total control of what goes in your meal.  No need to ask your server to hold this, add that or make any (obnoxious) substitutes.  Tip: If you seriously pack your bowl, no need to get the 2 trip option.  It's pretty impressive how much food will fit into that little bowl and somehow, it seems like even more once it's cooked.  Join the Ghengis Rewards program for lots of promos and goodies.  You won't be disappointed.  Oh, one last thing - please wash your freaking hands before filling your bowls and keep your darling little children away from the food if they're unable to keep their hands to themselves.  Please and thank you!

2zf6T7a5mo91FicHoQoM3Q.text: First time trying this place! Alyssa was our server,  she was super helpful and friendly. You build your own bowl with meats/proteins, sauces, spices and veggies, they grill it for you, and they bring it to your table! We also had a shareable margarita! Man, that thing was huuuugeeee for only $17 (like 3-4 strong drinks in a huge cup), we were soo stuff we barely finished it.

_oG1R6vtgUZ2BoZz-PvzXA.text: So an amazing experience my friend, her little girl and I had. The food was delicious. You get so much for the small amount that you pay. I have nothing but good things to say.  I will definitely be returning often.

iVUJFC_fIBBZ3KdwT0mIOw.text: First time here ! For a  BUSY Saturday night I was impressed by the Great customer service!!!!Every staff person was impeccably friendly and helpful!! It put me at ease in the midst of crying kids and restless teens! Filling up your own bowl of proteins veggies and sauces was interesting but probably will be easier and more enjoyable without a crowded line and elbows reaching across your faceThe food gets cooked while you return to your table. Everything tasted good !  The drink bar needs a bit more variety but for food and service as a casual stop I recommend it !

w8up3AuSXThLrdQ_CM7oyw.text: This a great place for lunch or dinner.  You get to pick out your meats, vegetables, spices and sauces.  Love the food here.  The service was slower than normal- sounded like we got there at the end of a rush.  If it wasn't for the food, we actually may have walked out and gone somewhere else.  But knowing how much we enjoy the food, we stick it out and it was great!

68a2Gpf2tNPWxDsaDMnnhg.text: We've been to this location twice now as Genghis is an amazing restaurant. However, that is where the quality of their food ends... their name.  Both times that we have been here the food bar has been subpar, missing items, not replenished, and they don't appear to be fresh.   The wait staff both times were arguing between each other, and this last time we were in, the manager even got involved yelling at the staff in front of us, and antagonizing other staff that were actually working.  The manager entertained "bro time" with his staff at the bar, and started to crack their backs as a chiropractor would. Not sure what that was about, but we will not be visiting again.

7FPUm0Fo-xsEwzzOsykeoQ.text: I had never heard of this place before...but had driven past is various times and decided to stop and see what it was all about. The concept is pretty simple, you purchase a bowl (out of three sizes) and fill it up with all the protein and vegetables you want. I chose the medium size and it came with the option of picking two sides. With the large you can pick 3 and with the small 1. The medium was more than enough and I had plenty of food to take home. The server was very nice and she told us to fill up the bowl as much as we wanted. This is good to know because at first the bowls can seem small but they actually fit a lot of food.   You do have to season your food and pick the sauces you want in your stir fry. Each seasoning has a small teaspoon and I really recommend you don't go overboard here. It is easy to over season and end up with a salty mess. I also recommend you go slow on all of the sauces. It is also easy to pick too many sauces and then end up with a soupy over seasoned meal.   I do have to say that my and the hubbies meals came out really nice. We were pleased with all of the options. We also tried their Nutella dessert which was pretty good. The crispy friend wonton filled with Nutella and drizzled with honey were delicious. The ice cream per se was ok.   My only recommendation is just to be careful with your sauces and spices. It would be nice for the restaurant to have sort of a recommended guide for its costumers detailing which sauces pair well with others and how to season meats. Otherwise the service was excellent and the food came promptly. Thanks!

36KAF9hrmU3j4OyDAH_wvA.text: If i could leave ZERO stars I would.  Slow service from the start.  By the time I get my bowl to fill, I go over and half the items are empty. Theres no restocking. The mushrooms are litteraly frozen to the pan, the seasonings are missing scoops. Theres chickin IN the steak. Theres shrimp in the chicken.  The handles are all dirty.  Finally get my bowl to the chef.  Tip them VERY well hoping they would actually cook my shit right. TWENTY MINUTES LATER, bowl after bowl goes out and mine still isnt ready.   I left.  Cancel that!!!!!!! Terrible place. Dirty. Slow. Waste of time.  Never going back!

mpepywWXYra56VlcJEXF4Q.text: This place is FANTASTIC with their superior customer service and delicious food. Everyone here is willing to help and you're not constricted to only asking "your" waiter for assistance with anything. The drinks are self-serve which is nice because they're the coke freestyle machines and I always appreciate being able to refill at my own pace so I don't leave a full cup behind. All of the staff are lighthearted and can always be found with smiles because you can tell they all like their job (or at least at really good at pretending!). I'm pretty good at stacking my food so I needed a size up with the bowl and they even split it into two large bowls because of how much food I had. As a result the rice got kind of lost underneath all the other food and they gave me more, complementary!  Overall it's a great atmosphere, great food, and some of the best customer service you'll receive in Vegas.

7c8rMUTHXTahON-u62mZog.text: Phenomenal quality and options. Only complaint is that you do not have the option to take your leftovers home if you purchase the "all you can eat" bowl. Other than that, this is our favorite Mongolian BBQ spot in Vegas!

WN6BhZYhxrR5Bc84XPXTuQ.text: Our waiter was very kind and the food was good. Those two factors are the only reason this restaurant is getting more than a 1 star, because the price and starch portion quickly made this a place I don't think I'll frequent again. I've only ever been to Mongolian grill restaurants in Chicago, but I'm used to them being "all you can eat." Not only is this a single serve restaurant, but there is no kids menu. My son had to get the smallest bowl, which was still pretty pricey.  The sizes of the bowls left me hopeful...until our food was brought to us. The amount of rice that was given to my son, and the noodles for my own bowl, were laughable. I was so shocked that I even commented to our waiter that the starch portions seemed rather small. I had hoped that the portions would at least reflect the price and the fact that this isn't "all you can eat." Guess I was wrong. I'm really bummed, becasue as I said, the food was good. But my son and I both left hungry. I've found other restaurants in the area that are "all you can eat", have a kid's menu, AND are less expensive than this. I'll give them a try.

bwQhCima6kFjeqaI07f9ng.text: My first time trying Genghis Grill. I've done Mongolian bbq many times bet the staff was very helpful when we told them we'd never eaten here before. The food selection was great. Lots of different meats, first time I'd seen bacon on a Mongolian bbq. The meal was cooked perfectly. There were lots of seasonings and sauces to choose from. The restaurant was clean. The self service soda machine was nice. Would definitely recommend.

8k3_7EnhP0o8SVUjtf36Fg.text: Food was amazing. I'm an awesome chef! Lol. Had a real nice experience. The server was really nice. The manager was really nice and funny (younger Hispanic guy).he was making jokes with us.  I'm Coming back again for sure

QJCqtaXS4HXh0uufYYmiWw.text: This is a really awesome stir fry cuisine. Sizes to choose from small, medium, large. Whatever you can pack in the bowl, they will cook!   I ordered a large size and wish I got a medium! Great selection of meat to choose from and marinated well. I chose the steak, chicken and shrimps. Sides was mushroom, onions and others but I forgot. But there's tons of veggies to choose! For sauce I poured the garlic.  After you fill your bowl, you drop off your entry to the chef and they cook it right there! You could either wait there and watch their magic or sit at your table and the server will bring it to you.   Food came out magnificent and every taste was mesmerizing   Thank you!

OV0TGCHWyhEbc634ZpoKlg.text: I am saddened to write this review because I loved this place. However, today's experience was pretty bad. Our waitress was great. The cooks on the other hand were "something else." One cook was on his phone while cooking the food on the grill. An extra order of potstickers were made and same cook helped himself to them not gloves then returned to cooking. One of the waitresses asked for a red bowl and he was talking so loudly and not paying attention she had to ask several times. Finally, she raised her voice and then he laughed about.   The sauce cups were soaking wet with sauce residue which means they were completely clean or dried off. So were the trays to the point my food almost fell off the tray.   As stated before we always come out to this side of town to eat here, but I will reconsider next time.

koZKymhj8TLk2ouDhw7W2A.text: Ok went for the 1st time- kinda put up a fight... in the past I have been to plenty of buffett or make your own type places and end up w a bowl of uneatable food and a belly still angry, hungry and sad. I gave in and the people I went with 2 of 3 of us had never been here-  We were greeted at the door by hostess. She was a pleasant young gal who asked have we been here before- I think she could see my lack of excitement or want to be there but talked with ad as she sat us explaining that out server would be right over and if I had any doubts or dislikes to come let her know- So comes in our sever- Jaakko (yes this is his name) what a lovely man, his attention to everything and detail was over and beyond. He was not only friendly but he ooozzed hes passion for his job and love ove what he did. He explained how the ordering and making of the bowls worked- we laughed and he broke the ice and fear of this new place for me. He more then once said he would suggest ideas or I could read/ get us cards provided w recipes to make. He also was helpful on serving size (3 to choose from) it seems so simple but cups are deceiving and you could easily order a size WAY more then you could eat if this wasn't explained. The line you go through has a huge selection of meats and veggies. The selection is so vast you could eat 3 meals a day for a week with out having the same meal. You get to choose a sauce to add flavor along w seasoning and then off to the cooking area. Your asked choice of starch or even cabbage (vs rice, noodles, ect). I was offered an egg to add to it and it was a great success! I cant even tell you the shock of feeling like a chief and having control of  what I was eating and what was added or not. I was asked and offered if I didn't like it to be able to remake it but it was so good I cant wait to go again.  Now this isnt fine dine but for sure not a fast food place... it was a great costumer service experience and I cant tell you how great our service was. Thank you. Cant wait till I try more boldly bowls!!

dmcCXwVjhsOT9SiGT_l0zw.text: The food is ok but not for the price? This is a glorified Buffett. A family of four was 100.00 with a few appetizers. So over priced and no quality and service that warrant the expense!

0da23UA0GQS4y4tJcIjBbA.text: Fresh ingredients, great selection, friendly and accommodating staff.  Glad we tried it - will definitely be back!

6JqkLTS5K3-_dlimE7F7Dw.text: This is the best place in the word. The meal size and the price are to cry for  thank you for bring joy to my taste buds

xUnNcAORIO6fDL0tTkTLNw.text: So I come here very often and it has gotten better every time. Not sure if that's my skill level at stacking my bowl or the flavors they offer in the selections. I have so much good to say about this place from the staff to the food to the atmosphere always showing espn on every screen big plus for me. I would say that I love how u just have to ask for shrimp and they add at the grill only minus is they are some ver small shrimp. Also I'm not a fan of being sat right by the entrance door when there are seats available all through out. But that doesn't outweigh the deliciousness of the meal. Being able to put as much as u can in a bowl recreating the leaning tower of pizza is the goal and they encourage it. Your pretty much the chef and what u choose to be in your food is what your going to eat so don't be bashful. Overall an amazing experience for adults and children alike!! I'll always come

XWV1ererJSmwpY0xeV1rOA.text: Been here a ton in the past, but it had been a while since I'd stopped in. We ordered to go and sat in the bar area waiting. The general manager was making drinks and chatting with us. I was super impressed by his level of service and that of his staff. Would highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys stir-fry.

aN-9n6LnWnwtQAxsVk5F3A.text: I just had the worst service ever. With the way the restaurant is set up, the only job of the waitress is to bring my bowl, bring me a box for my leftovers, and bring my check. I waited 25 minutes after I was clearly done with my food for my waitress to bring me a box. I had my card out so she'd know I wanted my check. Then it took her 10 minutes just to bring my check. I told her when I got there I had a free bowl and she wrote down my rewards number. She didn't discount the bowl. I had to wait another 10 minutes for her to bring my new check. HORIBBLE EXPERIENCE!!!  One good thing - the food is good.  *Update: I ALSO GOT FOOD POISONING! *Update: The manager did try calling me and emailing me. I told him/her there is nothing he/she can do to make me go back, but I did appreciate his/her customer service.

uyo2kp0CkZAqEWfCMN_FZg.text: Gone down hill since they opened.   Used to be my favorite spot.   It's become filthy. Yesterday ate with my boyfriend and both got sick and still today suffering.   My Roomate on a different occasion had the same issue..  Clean it up, get more organized and it'll become golden!

Zm4xgk5Gh_2JDoiI7MHDBw.text: Healthy food great service server Wendy explained how it works took us on a small tour on how to begin a bit confussing for those who had never done the Mongolian Style of filling your own bowl with choices exp. before.  Being that I had this exp. before it was slightly different since I was expecting a bowl to fill up the choices before grilling as they had a choice of silver plates asking you if you would like small, medium, or large.  Well I chose medium started to fill my plate with choice of Siracha Chicken and when I t was time to pick out the spices just have fun with it do not get technical choose what excites you same with the veggies whatever catches your eye and at the end when it comes time to choose your sauces for flavor do half of one choice in your side cup and add half of another flavor sauce choice in the same side cup.  Finally when you get to the grilling area again do not get techinical have fun I did half Udone Noodles and half Brown Rice.  Quite enteresting dish when the server brought our food I created a very flavorful exotic and fun mix as long as you do not get techinical just choose what appeals to you and do now worry how it will come out and that is how I will say you will enjoy this place have fun and just get creative with your choices!  If you get to techinical you will miss out on the exp. of having a creative dish that you just invented and do not worry everything is great here so sure to be flavorful!

K0_BZw1FVvo_ISn0u9AR1g.text: We have dined here many times and after eating lunch here today, I'm not sure I would go back.  Things seem to be going downhill. The sign on the front door said they were out of a few of their sauces, not a huge deal, but strange and we were at least informed before getting in line.  The area where you make your bowl wasn't well stocked and they were even completely out of a few things.  The sauce area was VERY messy and needed to be wiped down.  Nobody was behind the area to service it   We ate around 3pm, and eventhough they weren't busy, they were behind on the cooking of the bowls.  The whole cooking area looked dirty.  The hand washing sink next to the grill was broken and spurted water up onto the wall and caused the floor to be wet.  Used metal bowls and dropped food debris could be seen on the floor as well.  The whole place needed a cleaning and some repair work.  An upholstered booth seat was heavily torn and the black tape used to cover the holes had been there long enough that it was peeling up and almost gone.  Why not get something liked that fixed?  Even the edge of the red bowl my food was served in was chipped. Lunch for 2 with sodas was $40 including tip. The food tasted fine and the service was average, but the lack of cleanliness and normal maintenance makes me not want to return.

kWM54z7A7WpjggoTW7JWng.text: I tried this place a couple months ago but forgot to review it. I am very happy this place exists. My girlfriend told me it was "soooo gooood" and I thought it would be alright but after coming here she was right. The food is delicious and the staff is friendly. I even had a 5-minute conversation with one of the servers about tattoos. Super relaxed place and friendly environment. But let's be real you guys want to know about the food. Well, the food was just AMAZING. I am begging my girlfriend to come back here but she doesn't want to because supposedly Genghis Grill is a Reno thing so she is keeping me away at least until I go to Reno with her and try it again over there. Why are girlfriends like this? Anyway, try this place. I'll come back after my Reno trip.

IgkjLdBa9EAPgU8bE08bIw.text: Seriously?!?! I don't know if I should attribute the deliciousness to my seasoning  or to them for being so brilliant with the concept and execution?! I wish we had one closer to home. For now I only come here for lunch. It's a casual setting but also good as a dinner spot! I haven't even begun to tap into the many possibilities of the bowls I can create. I'll be coming back! Build it yourself and pack as much into that little bowl as humanely possible!!!!

rlk5xg3JXVtCEpm8V-C3RA.text: I will never come back here again... They under cook their pork which is a big no no and got my son sick to his stomach. Then when we pointed it out to management he said what would you like me to do... Like really???

1_cVv-lZOsB_frL8K6GE0w.text: BYOB - Build your own bowl- So at the persistent nagging of my friend to check this place out i finely obliged. The seating area could use some sprucing up, looks like they put yard sale furniture to decorate. Oh well on the food. I went for the regular bowl and my friend coached me into the building process. I picked out chicken,pork and beef along with some bellpeppers and other goods.  The dudes that take your bowl and cook had blank looks on their faces which was kinda disturbing they didn't greet me tell me what my # was nothing. Any who grabbed our drinks and sat down to wait for the chow. It was pretty good but not phenomenal, usually they have these build a bowl stations at some Asian buffets. The price tag was a bit steep for what they give you. The hostess gals were nice, service was prompt. Probably won't make a habit out of visiting here unless it's one someone else's dime. Their portion to price ratio is a little skewed for my taste.

BkoCoWAeI39rHp3iFJEbmg.text: I really enjoyed this place. The meat was yummy. The staff was super friendly in explaining what to do. A friend and I went in on a Saturday night and were seated right away. My only complaint is that there isn't one closer to me.

SxV_XiexR20Y9J3mHBmlHA.text: I love the Mongolian style  bbq That being said this place needs Help !  How do you mess up a bowl When you make it yourself ? When you tell them fried Rice And your bowl comes back With noodles and black debris From a non clean grill Went 4 weeks in a row Hoping it would get better It was right 1 out of 4 times Not to mention I was the first one In there 1 time and the sit me the Furthest away from drink station What kind of servers don't get your drinks But expect a nice tip !

YS9QxUa5q8SQwKufKXhLBA.text: Interesting to go to a Chain style grill place.  Price - 5 star - For lunch, you can fill up your little saucer for 8.99 and then add your choice of starch.  Makes for a nice lunch meal   For 2.00 more, you can have a second bowl or more.  Ambiance - 5 star - Clean organized, plenty of seating.  Roomy too.    Food - 2 star - All very nice in presentation,  well cooled.  However, everything was very hard to get to, the plexiglass protection from your face to the food is so short that anyone over 5'10 has to bend over and stretch to get to the food.  Overall, very inconvenient, but large choice of meats, vege and sauces.  Cooked - 2 star This is very uninspired.  IT is grilled on the big hot grill like all Mongolian Grills are.  However, the taste just comes out "okay"  It isn't to die for, and is quite like having cafeteria food.  Decent, filling, and not bad.  Just not great.  Service - 4 star - everyone is very well trained, cordial, pleasant and it would be a five star, but there is not a lot to "serve" other than drinks, hot sauce and the bill.    Overall, a nice clean and decent place to dine.  Just not really asian food. It is same as going to Panda Express for Chinese, or Taco Bell for "mexican".  Good for American Style, just not really authentic.  They have a nice bar, that is a plus for you Thirsty Dogs!

71GPWUhkK8OIAglo922-XQ.text: No complaints, besides I wish it was the old management! I used to sit at the bar all the time and drink while eating. But now the drink prices are twice as much! This isn't my first choice of food, but would always go because the bar. Food is good, juss make sure when your adding the ingredients you like all of them together! Lol I started picking stuff I liked. And realized I don't like all of them together as much. Lol.

G3b0_dPpI0lUJfqdcF6Zxw.text: Who doesn't love Mongolian bbq!? I always love places that have no limits to what you can put on your plate!   This is one of those restaurants where you can completely control what proteins, spices, veggies, sauces, and starches go into your bowl. There's no limit to how much you want; as long as you can fit it in your bowl you're good to go!   Their buffet set up is usually stocked and well kept but the last couple times I've eaten here, they seemed to be dropping the ball. Meats would be completely out or spices that you would see one day wouldn't be there the next. I totally understand a container being empty, but when you ask the employee if they can restock it and you never see them again, it gets a little frustrating.   Other than those inconveniences, they're always quick with getting your bowls cooked and have delicious options for the whole family!

U3-uqhae5w7b7EYc57AMUw.text: This was a great experience and was food was all great. The seasonings were great I just wish I used a bit more, I was a bit shy on the seasonings because it was my first time here. They have a good amount of selections between beef, chicken, and seafood. Good vegetables vegetables and sauces too. It was a very pleasant experience. Food was cooking timely and wasn't over cocked.  The only issue i had the server wouldn't come by often, I sat with an empty bowl for quite some time but since we came with a large group and were talking most of time time, didn't affect the experience too much.  They also use a lot of udon noodles, maybe to fill you up faster Incase you get the unlimited bowl. I was able to eat 2 bowls both with udon noodles.  Overall it was fun and great food will definitely return.

1R7i0ORuDHB718khLpT1Og.text: I've finally stopped in after driving by this place for years...I'm glad I finally made a visit...  Genghis service and ambiance:  The layout is like a hybrid restaurant/franchise setup with plenty of seating and Mongolian decor.  After you pick the size of your bowl, you go and load it up to be freshly cooked by the chef afterwards.  When your bowl is complete the server delivers your food to the table.  Our server was fantastic but it took awhile to get our bowls.  After 20 minutes it came around. You serve your own drinks at the Coca-Cola soda machine that hosts a plethora of drinks to choose from the Coke family products.  Genghis cuisine:  We started with the pot stickers and they were good for a casual restaurant. All the dishes we ordered were flavorful and cooked well by the chef.  My sesame beef with Udon noodles was very tasty and got me full quickly.  I also tried the chicken with udon noodles and the chicken was juicy and savory.  Hats off to the chef for putting together all the bowls very well.  The AYCE is a great option if you're really hungry and have the time to bring up multiple bowls to be cooked.  For me, the large bowl was plenty of food and I was stuffed.  They packed up the food that we couldn't finish which add to their great service.  I'll probably swing by again to try different meat and sauce combos sooner versus later.  Enjoy!

GzNInc3SalbZdrXwY2UCzA.text: Love this place! You have some options when it comes to bowls, all of which depend on how hungry you are. There's small, medium, large, and unlimited. I personally go with small, since you can stack it up as far as you can!  You go up to a bar with an array of meats and veggies, and finish by choosing a sauce and base (noodles, rice, etc.) The steak tips are awesome! Use as many veggies as you want as well.   The service is super fast. We came in and were seated immediately. Got our food within 10 minutes!  I definitely would recommend this place! They also have lunch specials on the weekdays, it's the best!

I am so glad I tapped to look at their food.   You can't go wrong with this place, you can pick all the things you want in your stir fry and they encourage you to really load the bowls up. I wish we lived closer to this place because I would be here at least once a week.  Once you pick out your ingredients and sauce you take it to the grill and you pick your noodles, rice, or other mix ins.   I love they have such a variety of sauces, meats and ingredients to pick from.   They cook the food just right and it's so delish!  The staff is friendly and engaging. They were very eager to explain the process.   I will be back soon!

No21qLldU-HO9ihBoqSecQ.text: This place is amazing!!  I love the whole fill your plate to the rim and there you go. Ok so here's how it goes, for those that haven't been to this amazing establishment before. So once you walk in you get seated by the greater obviously and your server comes by and sets down 3 plates a small, regular and large one. I usually go with the regular one because if you fill it up how I fill it it's more than enough (well for me) And then you go and attack the assembly line of meats and veggies! If you can't or don't even want to make up your own beautiful creation of random meats and veggies there is always the cards they have so you can pick and follow what they say. So what I do is load up on veggies and then come back and pile up the mountain of my meat options and after you do that you move on to pick your sauce and take it to the counter and pick your noodles and what kind of rice you want (if you want rice) and after that you sit and wait to have your creation brought to you and ENJOY! My experiences here have always been great and I highly recommend this place to everyone!

JdaNf6xrIZD6AGo3Z4c4iQ.text: First if all, they kept me waiting for a while before I could order. Plenty of people were walking by without saying "someone will be right with you." AZEyIvsPlJpjLj7UjQWhsg.text: Food was good. Service wasn't great but you get what you pay for. It's like a small fast food but you choose what you want to eat and how much of it. Other than that it was a pretty good place.

R4ojBSwkOmItIM0wfKnJNg.text: Very nice place, pretty clean and smelled delicious. I was kind of taken aback by the 3 bowl sizes they have. Grant it, you can drink all you want but you choose a bowl size with 1 trip. You can take your leftover food home in a to go box. That's a plus.   With regards to the table layout, it was pretty nice. Easy to navigate through the areas and the ingredients area was clean.  The food was delicious and I would go back to eat if I had to meet someone there. At least try it - you will definitely like it.

h1JDMsNibtQzNSzf4Y6xwQ.text: This was my first time visiting Genghis Grill. The experience is quite interesting. You pick the size bowl you want and then select your choice of proteins and veggies to be added to your bowl. You will have your choice of seasonings and sauces for your creation. This is where I went wrong. I didn't know if the spices had salt or not so I erred on the side of caution and under-seasoned. Be liberal with the salt and pepper and then add at least two of the cups provided of sauce. One cup of sauce is not enough! Mine was a bit dry due to a lack of sauce. I have no one to blame but myself though.   Once you've finished preparing your bowl, take it to the counter and it will be cooked for you. You can choose to add cabbage or noodles at this point. I hear that you can also add hard boiled eggs for no additional charge.   It will take a while to get your food out to you so best not dine here if you are in a hurry.   My only suggestion would be for the servers to give sauce to bowl ratio recommendations. For example: if you get a large bowl, add 3 cups of sauce, or seasoning recommendations, "try the Cajun seasoning with the garlic sauce." This would be very helpful.

2nK58iyI938MnVzMdMZUyQ.text: The food is good, if you know how to pick and mix your flavor sauces.  I wish they had some menu about combinations to make so I did not have to figure it out.  Love that you can put cabbage in your stir fry and no do starches.  However, this place is Pricey for what you get.  $15.00 is a full order entree at most Asian style restaurants that is shareable.  All of your protein and vegetables have to fit in this bowl and things like spinach cook way down.  I hate to say this but to get your money's worth you really need to just get protein and pack it in there really well.  The service is excellent but the beverages are pricey as well and they are self serve.  I think for four people our check was $100.    Its just a little over the top for a casual Asian place in pricing.

3HZ5i7IYgmnlx8OY6LjJSg.text: First time coming here and it was great! Good food, fresh ingredients and great customer service. Definitely my go to place. Need to have more locations :)

cPCTuMFdBaBIb1zk8v8XXg.text: I've tried this place twice and each time the anticipation was greater than the end result.    The idea is so exciting because the possibilities seem endless.  You can pay for unlimited meals or just one, but either way it seems a little expensive for what you get.  They give you 2 bowls - one for your food and a smaller one for your sauce.  You build your meal by going through a buffet line and choosing your meat(s), veggies, seasoning, and sauce.  You can pile it high to the point of overflowing or you can keep it small.  Tip: the veggies really shrink when cooked so your bowl will look a lot emptier when it comes back to you.  Fill accordingly.  Then you choose your starch (rice, pasta, noodles, etc.) when you get up to the grill.    The line is the real issue at this place.  If there's more than one person ahead of you, prepare to move through at a glacial pace.  As people mull over the options, or if they are out of something that someone wants and you need to wait for the employees to refill it, you WILL. NOT. MOVE.  It's horrible!    I've tried a few of the sauces and the only one worth a damn to me is their 3G sauce - their basic one that they say goes with everything.    I do like their soda machines (the type that you can choose any drink and add flavors).  They also have a full bar so you can grab cocktails with your meal.    I guess it could be a good place if no one is there when you are and you find your favorite sauces/combos.  But to me, it's not cheap enough/good enough to deal with the line.  If I want mongolian grill and feel like waiting on a line, I'll pay less money and go to Green Valley's Feast Buffet.

2jt-DSULdGp4Dz22ilkhrw.text: First time I had Ghangus Grill was in Fort Collins Colorado. Was so pleasantly surprised when I discovered there was one in Las Vegas. Both of us were sick with food poisoning for 36 hours.  I am assuming the chicken wasn't cooked enough.     We will NEVER return to Genghis Grill.

AC3X_ZL_SInEQjR-Ior7pA.text: Worst 15 dollars that I have ever spent and that was just for lunch. Let me explain.  I come in on a Wednesday around 11:30 am. I am greeted by the host and shown to a table. Since I have never been here before, I am briefed on the process of getting my food. They give you two of what appears to be small dog food bowls and a small dipping sauce type of cup. One bowl you put in veggies and the other meat. For the dipping sauce type of cup, yup you guessed it, different sauces to mix in to your choices when it is being cooked.  Once you are done selecting your choices, you go up to the counter and hand it off to whoever is there that will cook it on the big circular flat top grill. You have to specify what kind of carb you want cooked with your ingredients like brown rice, noodles, etc. Then when its done cooking, your server will  bring it out to your table.  Now what I just described doesn't sound bad now does it? What im about to break down for you should convince you not to come here or at least if you try it, you will be uttering, "Oh, that's what Roger T was talking about in his review."  First off, you have two options to decide before you start eating. Single trip or all you can eat. Prices are as follows: Lunch 8.99. Dinner 10.99. Add 4 dollars more to do the all you can eat option. By the way, it used to be 3 dollars.  Since I was really hungry and planned on making multiple trips to get my money's worth, I chose the 13 dollar all you can eat. That is just for the food yall. Drinks are not included. I decided just to have water.  So I do my thing and try to cram as much meat and veggies into my bowls. Their meat and veggie choices all seem to be housed in tiny containers which makes you feel like a pig if you are trying to get a lot of a certain meat or veggie. By the way, the only difference between lunch and dinner is for dinner you get calamari and scallops. That's great news you say? Well, based on what I have seen, I wouldn't be surprised if these were tiny little cut up pieces.  I sit down and wait for my food. After about 5 minutes later, I received it in a weird odd sized bowl/plate? When I see my food, I swear I thought I put a lot of veggies and especially meat since I am a carnivore. What you gotta understand is when all these items you select are grilled together, they shrink a lot.   After I finished my bowl, I was ready to go and grab some more food. This is where the deception is because in order for you to go up and get more food, you have to tell your server exactly that and they will go get you new bowls. This is where you will notice the difference between these guys and other traditional Mongolian Grills. The ones im familiar with, you grab your own bowls and do your thing. The only waiting you do is for the cooking. Not these guys. Sometimes it takes a while for the server to come around just so you can ask for more bowls. Then you have to wait for them to come back with your bowls. Then you have to wait for it to be cooked. When it gets done cooking, it sits on the counter until your server picks it up and puts it on your table.  So you see this is where my gripe is. By the time I came around to my third serving, I was starting to feel that full feeling which doesn't make sense because at other places, I can easily go through 3 servings and not feeling full at all. The process that you have to go through to get your food, whatever you ate prior is starting to settle which gives you the im not hungry feeling any more.   My total bill came up to about 14 and some change. I put 15 bucks on the table and walked away. My server was slow in everything. Don't get me wrong. Its not like I was in a rush but at the same time I don't have all day. I think this place is a scam. Their process purposely slows everything down so you don't get to eat as much as you really want. The day I went, it didn't get really busy until about 12. When it gets really busy, you will have to wait even longer in between each serving.   So you see, it really isn't worth it to eat here whether you choose all you can eat or not. I recommend going to the Fiesta Buffet just up the street off of Lake Mead for their Mongolian Grill. Lunch is 7 bucks and dinner is 10 bucks with a player card. You not only get two big bowls to put ingredients in, but the only time you wait is when it is being cooked. Plus they have other choices there and not just the Mongolian. Its not the best but it sure as hell beats out these guys. This also will prompt me to check out Stir Krazy Mongolian Grill on Paradise Rd since I heard good things about them.

VaI-7Q8D4dPk8NbDTczHXw.text: I ate here last year & forgot just how much I love this place! You create your own dish however you like. Select your type of meat from chicken to crab to beef to turkey or more. Select whatever veggie you like including some fruits. Choose your seasoning/s & sauce/s then your choice of carbs (noodles, rice, etc). Pile it up as high as you like! Pass it on to the chef & they make it for you & have it served to you at your table. You can def end up making 2 meals out of your one meal you've made. The food is so delicious! You can actually order your food from your table as well via their mini IPads.   This is def a place you have to check out as it is alot of bang for your buck, healthy as much as you like it, & VERY tasty & if it's not well guess you should remove some items for next time since you're the creator. Too bad there isn't one closer to where I live

nUf7AT3XbATqUuCTAw4UlQ.text: The food was excellent. They just need to have more locations. I live in N. Las Vegas.

eLQwB59xNdHR7CBT11DeJQ.text: Redemption?: After a 1 Star Review, has Genghis improved? With family in from Nebraska who wanted Mongolian BBQ it was time to find out. And after my 1st review of this place brought me a LOT of flak, private messages, and even some hate messages, I was like I'm going to wait to do a 2nd review. But that time is now and here it is. (I edited / added to this review, critics can go read the additional comments at the bottom.)  We went in for lunch on a Friday and I stayed quiet acting like I had never been there before as the person with me had not been there. We were seated promptly and given our super tiny little dog bowl for our meat choices and the hamster sized water cup for our sauces and listened to the whole spiel. Then we got dragged up to the counter and was having the process of bowl building explained when we got rushed through it as another horde of people started to come through.   It's still a pain in the rear to reach the food offerings to build your bowl with, the calimari and high end meats are gone, the spices are lame as I said before, and the black and brown goo sauce choices are still there. The same slow griller process is also in place, and yes they still use the absolutely asinine cards with the bowls to keep track of things. ( BD's does it so much better! ) The person I was with kept comparing it to HuHot in Lincoln, NE and she said out loud that this process sucked.   The food we got was ok. I ignored the griller recommendations and went with brown rice. Brown rice is hard to mess up, and it provides some food stability. (It's that Misti Y influence at work again.)  It's one item that usually won't suck. It was a good choice as this time the food was not as bad as last time.  But after I got tired of using the chopsticks I went to unwrap one of the cheapest food service mass produced forks in history only to find it's DIRTY! SCREECHING HALT IN PROGRESS, oh no Boo-Boo, we don't do dirty utensils. You will bring me another one like right freakin now! 4 min later a new fork arrives and I eat the rest of my lukewarm bowl. Across the table she barely eats about 1/4 of her bowl. Now keep in mind she's not inexperienced at Mongolian BBQ, she's ate it in 6 states, multiple different places too, and for her to only eat 1/4 of her bowl...ugh. I ask for her opinion, and she's nice and says it's "ok". Then I ask about how they compare to BD's and she's like this place sucks compared to them. Enough said. So after getting one more offer to buy an overpriced dessert we get our check. With an 18% tip it's almost $29 for 2 people to have lunch. Choking back that I just got seriously ripped off feeling I signed the check and headed for the door.   I did tell the staff that things have improved (Hey, they didn't spill something at the table this time so I was being honest!) But 45 min later I began to get sick. Did you know that from Pecos and Sunset to Sunset and I-515 there are 4 Terribles locations with bathrooms? I can now give reviews on 2 out of those 4 thanks to Genghis Grill's food. What's worse is when 2 people have urgent needs to use the same bathrooms. They need bigger restroom facilities that can handle more than 1 person at a time. There's also a great CVS pharmacy close to the Fox 5 studios on Sunset that sells Imodium tablets that kept our Friday from being an ode to Charmin type day.   I'm sorry but 1 Star is where this crappy place stays, and it gets bumped to my Call the Health Department list as my stomach still hurts almost 24 hours later.  Edit:  1: I know how to SERIOUSLY stack. And I still feel the bowls are way too small compared to their competitors offerings.  2: The sauces suck, period. I will mix my own sauces, I don't need someone to do it for me. And as for the product they've dumped out there for people to use, I can get better stuff at Vons off the shelf.  3: Pricing even with sales tax variations is still higher when compared with Denver, Kansas City, and Minneapolis. How do I know? I just got off the phone after calling and asking and comparing it against the receipt I have in my hand.  4: If the Clark County Health Dept wasn't in such disarray of late I'd walk in a complaint in person on Monday since I'll be downtown. Might just do it anyway. An inspection would do this place some good. Buying Imodium after the fact should NOT be part of my lunch time costs. People can squawk all they want but restaurant food should not make multiple people sick after it's consumed. And there's not a critic on here that should question that.   I take these reviews with the utmost seriousness as I learned from Chef Gio at Old School Pizzeria that these reviews have impact. These reviews can make or even break a business. I don't write 1 star reviews for spite, I simply call it as I experience it.

BB7Dgyy6bRoBUeXaEkmxug.text: I really like it here. Our server was helpful and showed my husband and I how the restaurant works. You get a bowl and are able to fill it up with as much meat and veggies you want at the bar/station. You also pick your spices the sauce and the starch. The food is practically cooked in front of you (if you hang around the grill). The price is very affordable and if you want all you can eat its an extra $3.  There was a fundraiser taking place durning our visit and even though it was busy the service was relatively fast. I'm looking forward to going again.

1aoeM8lEpK7HQwqUKICnsA.text: The only two things I miss about living in Michigan are BD's and Flat Top Grill.  I have literally rerouted airplane trips to have layovers in Chicago and Dallas so I can run out for a bowl.  Thus I watched the construction of Genghis with baited breath and high fived the lord for putting it two blocks from my office.  For years, I got stirfry once or twice a week because one bowl lasts two meals (am I right, pro-stackers?!)  Sadly, it's been eight trips so far, and the place is still not quite right.  I will absolutely keep eating there, but I always tell them honestly when they ask how my visit was, and many of the frequent irritations seem easy to fix!  (Watch out, TL;DR coming!)  THE BAD:  1) The habitual mistake I see every time is how the grillers dump the bowl and walk away.  I have even watched my pile sit still until it's time to sauce.  The word "stir" in "stir fry" should have been on Day One of training, guys.  Move that shit around!   Aside from the performance aspect (which is supposed to be one of the selling features), it prevents food from burning itself to the grill, and flaking charred remains into my meal.  When you watch them plate your bowl, you see a thin black layer of food lost to the grill, which wouldn't happen if they kept the piles moving.  I cringe to think how much wasted food is hauled out of that trap every night.  At BD's the guys rotate around the grill, so every pile gets flipped a few times.  There's a fine line between leaving it long enough to brown, and ignoring it so long it burns.  I lose half my crab every meal because it's left behind, blackened to the grill.  STIR!  MORE!  2) The guys who designed the buffet dimensions suck and the store owners should demand a do-over.  I imagine it's hard to think of every body size and ability, but the back row is so far behind the sneeze guard, I literally have to bend over and press my shoulder against the rail to stretch far enough.  For a while, they had a guy back there handing you the unreachables.  Considering how much shrimp I eat, I sympathize with their tactics ... but the message is clear when they have two rows of fish and the shrimp in back: They don't want you eating it!  I've gone at 4:00 and the scallops weren't out yet, so I can only imagine they somehow create an additional barrier.  Portion it out in plastic cups if the cost is killing you!  3) The cooks need improvement for reading the card instructions, something time will fix I hope.  I have asked for rice on the side, and it was mixed.  I have asked for an extra sauce cup and they told me I have to ask my server.  I walked five feet over and grabbed it myself from the station.  I have asked for my bowl to go, and they handed me a plate.  I have gotten a bowl to go, and they handed me a To Go box sitting on a plate.  I ended up walking over to the server station and bagging it myself.  Rookie moves, guys!  4) The appetizers are disappointing.  Twice I have ordered appetizers and they arrived after my bowl.  The citrus salt is too strong on the edamame.  The lettuce gets soggy when you pour all the meat over all the lettuce.  Some lettuce should be on the side so it can stay crisp -- pouring hot meat and sauce on lettuce equals limp cooked lettuce for the last half of the dish!  THE GOOD:  1) After a few rough trips, we wrote an email listing our problems and the manager invited us back for a free meal.  Gold star response!  2) I pay $9 for Teriyaki Madness, and can get Genghis To Go in the same time for a dollar more -- but I get all the "Surf N Turf" I can stack.  I eat half for lunch and the rest for dinner.  Anyone who complains about the size of the bowls isn't doing it right and/or expecting the business to lose money.  I punish the Station Buffets like anyone else, but stand-alone restaurant owners walk a razor thin margin.  There's plenty of food and money for us all to go home happy and full, folks.  3) My friends and I have gotten diabolical with the game of stacking over the years.  My personal best involves tucking snowpeas along the rim to create a retaining wall, and pressing the meat down with a broccoli floret (don't use the tongs, because someone might be allergic to something else touched in your bowl.)  We are easily amused.  ;-)

_f1TranukA-suG3UHix8GA.text: Absolutely love this place! When you have that hunger that nothing seems to satisfy come here. At Genghis Grill you create your own bowl and are the architect of your entire meal. You can decide between 10 or so different types of meat, then go on to season them accordingly. After you move on to the vegetables and believe me you want to stack them as high as you can. Finally they offer you about 15 different choices of sauces as well as a few different starches such as rice, noodles etc. The bowls come out steaming hot and delicious. For those who are more bold they offer an endless bowl in which you can go up and refill as many times as you want. Overall this place is awesome, both food and service are excellent.

DJf9aE8x1hKORKQ74Yzi1Q.text: very nice..used to go to BD Mongolian all the time...but none in Vegas. *Womp Womp" Me and the wife tried Genghis Grill. Just like what I was used to. Food turned out good. At the time I wasn't impressed with the service. However I was told later the delays were related to a fund raiser for a school that was taking place. So I will have to go back soon. Food was good!! $3 more for unlimited eats!!!

hq1Lvi3a2JAkvL__oqC7QQ.text: Overpriced  This restaurant is overpriced. $11 dollars for a bowl? $3 dollars more for a self-serve soft drink? You've got to be kidding. The best thing here is the pork, can't think of anything exceptional. We have tons of these places in Southern California and only this place here in Henderson, so I suppose I should feel lucky. Still, I can't help but notice the difference between this and "what's possible".  It's a good meal, just not great and definitely not worth that kind of money.   Wait for the $6.99 bowl promos in the mail, otherwise avoid.

RNJJ3m8id3PqUOLRsjfW4Q.text: Awesome! Amazing protein choices! Flavor was fantastic and service was great. Can't wait to go back!

68Pd6BPihxhEOmWbSKOisQ.text: I tried this place for the first time and had a good experience.  Ingredients were fresh and they barely used any oil on the grill which is a good thing.  My only complaint is that the toppings table could have maybe been a bit cleaner as it had a lot of topping spills from people before me.

z7IPkvOJgX5VZg19iqB6EQ.text: Very happy to this open up.  I love mongolian barbeque and anytime I go to a buffet I order this fresh.  Nothing at a buffet at a local casino compares to Genghis Grill - there were more choices in meat, veggies, spices and sauces.  I do agree with other reviewers there are way too many tables in it and I could not reach the back row to get the shrimp and other options since I am 5'2 and have short arms.  I did like the TVs and got to watch some soccer and loved the decor.  We will give it a try again.

L8TmkK20Fj1VGtEUrLpEaQ.text: Went here again (7/5) to get my birthday bowl. GG corporate is pretty awesome and they extended my bday bowl a ways to let me get my bday bowl when we were in the area. Props to them for that. There seems to be a wait almost everytime we go there, but this time my veggies were cooked perfectly and my sauce was almost perfect (I put too much salt..dang) but overall it was a great $16 for 2! Love you GG!!

l1l9B36yer8-DAi15OOaMg.text: Always solid.. However they didn't have all the sauces and didn't seem to want to replace them. Seems service is slacking as well since they got those touch screens.

TsbyGz11JqSNrl7wC368pw.text: Decent food that is reasonably priced.  5 stars because this place is a good value for the cost.  I prefer for lunch.

lt6S-7JD_Vbo1WM3FgZVfQ.text: I love this place, and everyone I've ever introduced it to also loves this place. I also love that they offer different size bowls. I think the few things that I don't really like have been some of their recent changes. Such as you having to go and get your own drinks and use a tablet to order and pay. The waitstaff I hope makes more than a typical waiter or waitress because they don't really have to do anything so I can't imagine they make much in tips. They have started placing workers behind the food to keep everything full and clean. However I will admit that seeing all that open raw meat that people are grabbing themselves with tongs makes me a bit nervous. There's lots of opportunity for cross contamination, and for bacteria to grow on the meats and veggies. My recommendation would be to have the employees dish the meat for you. Other than that, it's been good every time I've gone.

3_tckHBkmTj59BlIVsmldA.text: So why would you beat up on a brand new place. obviously these are younger folks just trying to make money by starting here and you folks just throw them under the bus. This is not rocket science  but they do have some highly edumacated folks there. Yes they are a chain but yes this is new store. The concept is sound, the food is fresh and clean and only bad because you cant figure out how to season it. That is the whole concept. I sit at full service bar and am treated like king with my named asked for and used several times. Drink and food club stuff avail. All you can eat for 14.00 is cheap. If you dont know how to fill one bowl to the max and dont understand how meat shrinks when you cook it then pay the extra 3 bucks cheapass. I have been waiting for good Mongo since that place went TU on Flamingo near UNLV.  Give these guys a chance, ask questions the first time you are there, they will gladly help you out. Most of all give immediate common sence feedback on table size and such so they can at least look into improveing your crummy little life experience. Dont just go once, like it but whine about it!

A6ru1HSJQE7OR6dZJcfU9Q.text: You decide on the ingredients, they cook it. It's as simple as that. But even better, the service by an excellent staff is top notch. Our kids especially LOVED Genghis Grill.

gCm-5GCXHOhg3_5a7r-SHA.text: Finally tried it. Its a bit on the pricey side and they try their hardest to slow you down so you don't eat that much and up sell all the expensive appetizers and fancy drinks. They bring you these little dinky bowls to put your stuff in, which when cooked will amount to about 1/2 chinese food take out container. Have to get the all you can eat, or you'll starve to death from lack of food. They have way too many employees working at one time, they could get rid of about half of them and still run the place efficiently and maybe drop the bowl a buck or two, however the waitress we had was friendly, informative & helpful. The format is awkward at best compared to all the rest of the Mongolian BBQ's I have been to across the nation as they try to make this a restaurant experience & show instead of a Mongolian BBQ. It gets extremely crowded during the dinner hours and extremely loud, so crowded your practically bumping elbows with the party next to you. When you get up 3 tables have got to slide out of your way so you can squeeze through the little 4 inches in between tables (little over done, but you get the point). Kinda curious why they put on a "fire show" when they want you to sit down after giving them your bowl, you cant see it due to the booths and the yelling and gonging is kinda annoying.  If your tall like me, expect a workout to get anything under the sneeze guards. This place must of been designed by midgets (no offense to midget architects). The meats are average and they have a fair selection of veggies, but the sauces are either too sugary or too salty and unusually thick (like molasses) and its hard to fine tune to taste especially for heat. Don't listen to them when they say their sauces are hot. I dumped a ton of their real hot one (Khanzu Sauce) and it barely spiced it at all, and their powdered spices don't do much either.  But all said, I can make a fairly tasty bowl and that's why we came. Roommate really liked the Curry Peanut Sauce.  If I was on this side of town, and wanting Mongolian "style" BBQ, I would visit again. I figure I'll get the sauces down eventually, but it is definitely not worth a special trip or traveling from afar like from the Strip or Summerlin.  Well see if this place survives (which I doubt), its WAY too expensive for what you get.

gblkYsl5EOOGMjgIbwSNDA.text: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by this place. The fact that you get to choose all your toppings, seasoning, sauce and starch, as someone else mentioned, if it's not good you can really only blame yourself. They even have little cards that show u what things to add to make a certain type of bowl. So if you wanted a teriyaki chicken bowl you would include chicken, broccoli, pineapple, teriyaki sauce and your choice of rice. The card has the calories on there as well so If you follow the recipe you can estimate about how many cals your taking in. I made a really tasty Thai chicken Bowl with their spicy peanut sauce and udon noodles and it was really good. My only gripe was there was not enough sauce so it was a little dry which was my own fault. The server was friendly and attentive and we left full. The only thing i can say negative was right by the bathrooms there was this rank smell coming from I guess the kitchen area. Makes you wonder what's really going on.

A44WZ25hMeM9QgtSXs3oxA.text: My wife loves this joint , but every time we go (3x's total) the service is pretty sub-par...I dig the whole concept of "building your own bowl" but when that place gets a little busy they get less productive (behind the grill and in the floor)...the only plus about the joint I can say is that they have that bad-ass beverage machine that lets you go wild and release you're inner mixologist !!...food's decent tho service could be better tho.

bHdtftZDk8AUL-877boZoA.text: I love this place you get a big bowl u pick your meats,veggies,and/or fruit plus seasonings and sauce give it to the grill cooks they prepare your food on this giant grill,then give it to the waiter who then brings it to your tabl,it is so good,I go all the time,love it

4KkIvZz9JGw47HLvl8GsAg.text: First off, this place is good. The selection of meats are really unequivocally vast. You get get sausage, pepperoni, pork, beef, chicken, and for dinner scallops. You are prompted to start with a protein after getting your bowl from the hostess stand. From the meat stand you proceed to dry seasoning which I did not really notice in the end product because the final sauces you add to your separate sauce cup are so viscous they overpower the dry seasoning. After seasoning you pick your vegetable, of which there are many. They the afore mentioned sauces a next. There are again, many from which to choose, all made in house. They were good but they are very thick and slightly off putting. With your bowl piled high you walk up to the counter and select your starch, rice in several iterations and 2 noodle choices. I like that they add to starch so you do not have to cram it in the bowl. Now the service. The hostess as someone mentioned was slow to appear and when she did she walked up to us with her head down and was writing something for like 2 mins before she acknowledged us, it was rather rude. We did have a good waitress though, how hard is bringing drinks? Also, the wait staff were rather chatty with each other and their giggling was sort of annoying and it seemed to take precedence over my food waiting at the counter being delivered to me.  In fact I was with someone and they and already gotten their food and were full into eating before my meal came, though it was ready.  They do have a full bar and many different specialty drinks on their menu. I can for lunch though and I have no need to be bagged in the middle of the day. Bottom line, the place was good and I will be back to see if they improve or deteriorate. Hopefully they will be better next time and I can give a better rating because they have a potential for a great rating.

12DBJPC4a4uUv4GQgCGklA.text: Honestly I didn't think it's sanitize the chicken is raw and out for hours . The veggies are still old and tasted funny we went for dinner 25 $ for 2 people regular size bowl

cyzpOYzXNT-YdSt-iWwUgw.text: This place is good especially for individuals with allergy.  They also have menu for kids just in case they're picky eater.  Staff are very friendly too. They messed up our food but fixed it right away.  We'll definitely go back.

I1DMXWQfgLFp8PNJGkprqA.text: Okay so this place is not a restaurant you want impress your first dinner date with, but the loud, spirited stir fryers who cook up your Mongolian BBQ dish exhibition style (fire & all)  makes it a chill place you want to get together with your family and friends.  It's a AYCE joint.  There's a salad bar type area where you build and create your stir fry dish. Reminds me of the buffet part of Fiesta, but here you have more choices.   Ambiance - Contemporary design, casual atmosphere, the tables were a little squished in and noisy from everyone talking so loud that busy body me knows what's up in your life cause I can hear your convo. heh heh.   Service - Was greeted and seated right away....which was surprising considering it was super busy.  Our server Janine did great  She always checked up on us, kept our drinks filled and kept us up on the status of food which was being prepared. I didn't feel that our server offering us appetizers was "up selling" whatsoever, it's like at the burger place asking if you want fries with that? Just say no thanks that's all if ya dont want any.   Food - All the ingredients appeared fresh, the meats were cold, I didn't see any meats that were soaking in their juices that I had read in some reviews. (believe me I would've just left if I saw that)  The veggie choices were also at cold temps and were crisp.  The only thing I wasn't too crazy about was the noodles I chose the first time around.  My husband really liked Udon noodles  though.   So the second round I passed on starches and loaded up on tofu, veggies, lil bit of beef, 2 seasonings, cilantro, skipped up on the starches and got a lettuce wrap instead. When I tried my second bowl of stir fry I was pleasantly surprised at my creation it turned out pretty good! My suggestion, skip the salt and  ease up on the sauces.  You dont want to drown out your dish with more than 1/2 a cup of sauce. It might end up being too salty or too sweet taking way the flavor of your dish instead of enhancing it.  Hence that "tiny" cup of sauce should be more than enough.  Or check out the little card recipes as your guide. That's your safest bet on your meal turning out good.  Both my husband and I liked our food creations and we enjoyed our first dining experience here.

JVJ9vIrmTctMSn7WE4vKdA.text: A fast food Mongolian grill, nice idea, for some reason the decor reminds me of a panda express.  Anyways, as we know the food is what counts, so let's see.  A nice selection of proteins to pick from, one glaring issue, while its great to see them offering shrimp, they still have the vein in, not the first time I have seen this, but still not something I would eat.  Service has been good, waiter is very friendly, though my diet coke went MIA for a while.  I will say there is a large selection sauces to go on the food and they ask about allergy problems, of course selecting your own food to be cooked it should take care off this issue.  So the food has arrived, I guess I know how to pick good ingredients as it was pretty good. Some of the food was a little burnt, but all in all it was a good meal and certainly good for $11.  Gourmet it is not, but it doesn't pretend to be, it delvers as advertised to I am happy.  The waiter passed the empty glass test, it was quickly refilled.  So all in all, a good deal, good food, the shrimp thing bothers me though.

l7awM-aBTsHO3JzefTu3nA.text: My first impression wasn't very good.  I have been to many of the mongolian grills before and find they use frozen meats both killing taste and making your bowl look full but really on the thin side as the meat doesn't bend to make room in the bowl.  The restaurant atmosphere is essentially a cafeteria, not designed for comfort but rather to cram as many people into the restaurant as possible.  The concept is fun and my daughter loved it.  Grab your bowl and get in line, as you progress you choose your protien from shrimp, scallops, pork, chicken, beef, sausage, pepperoni, etc.  Then your spice including salt and pepper, cajun, etc.  You can mix spices. Then your veggies and there is a wide selection.  Finally your sauce, again you can mix and they even recommend some mixing.  They have sweet sauces for the kids and spicy ones for the adult kids :)    Then it is off to the cooking station to pick your starch from various rice and noodle options and then watch them stir fry your meal on the round grill.  I have to say the food was excellent.  The ingredients were fresh and not frozen, the flavor was great and the sauces were tasty.  The best thing is it is a bottomless bowl for an extra 2.95 (free for kids) so you can eat as much as you want.  We will be back soon!

OUzW08U2YkPLYM2A7NQLfw.text: I promised I would update my review! My husband is in love with this place. I'm not a huge fan but it has definitely improved. I think my dislike is that I'm just not a huge mongolian grill fan in general. The staff is generally on point, the GM (Reagan) is super sweet, and they definitely offer an excellent variety of options. It is not taking as long to get food as it did when they first opened. The service is much quicker now. I gave an extra star because my husband and kids love it so much. I'd go with 3 if it were me.

NHKhSoc-lJuVOxWqJvJNcw.text: Turned on to this place by a friend. When I walked in, immediately reminded me of Pei Wei. Seems like the same kind of concept, but you build your meal yourself.  If you don't come with someone who has experienced this place before, you could wind up skimping yourself on your meal. You are responsible for either building your dream bowl, or you can select from a few recommended templates. But, if you don't take into consideration that your meal will shrink drastically once it is fully cooked, your overstuffed precooked bowl comes to your table cooked and barely half the size it was before. I've even stacked to the point of carrying my bowl to the cooking station covering the edges with my hands to keep it all in and still got back a very small cooked portion.  All in all, the food tastes great, better yet, awesome, you just don't get a lot of bang for your buck and it's a pretty steep buck. But I give them brownie points for serving Coke Zero!

F6HSmqch9Q2wSpgXGgTkDw.text: My friend has been wanting me to try this place for quite some time. She says that the choices are good and the selection was better than others made it out to be. I am a huge fan of stir fry and was willing to give it a try.   Overall it was not bad, I just have an issue with a few items. One, the bowl that they give you is not that large. Even the best of stackers will have issues with getting the most veggies packed into that tiny half sphere. Two, for the $11 it is not worth it, but adding an additional $3 for unlimited is a decent value. Three, the scallops are not worth it. I know, you should never expect decent scallops, but these baby ones are tough after cooking. It felt like I was chewing on rubber.  The service was friendly and my server offered me a new bowl without judgment. I have had better experiences with Mongolian BBQ.

pttXQSDhmQMdiOzEuDktyw.text: Drove out here from Cali for the weekend and noticed I had a microwave in my hotel room. I looked up big eatery spots locally rather than the strip because Vegas is known internationally for their food. Genghis Grill came highly recommended by the locals. I went in around lunchtime and got the large bowl. I love this semi-buffet-ness of picking out your own portions of proteins and veggies and then having them cooked up in your face Benihana style with your choice of starch.(If this place would had more protein choices, I would have gave this place 5 stars) You're responsible for your portions, sauces and seasoning so, if it doesn't taste good, you got nobody to blame but yourself. When getting your bowl cooked up by the chefs, give 'em at least of couple dollars so they cook your food more thorough with love. You even get to get your own drinks, so if you're thirsty....again blame yourself. Service was friendly and decent. You get up and do everything yourself so they're minimal anyways in your experience. For basically $20 I got to eat 2 meals in one day and had more money and time left to play the tables. Definitely have a good game plan when you come in here to maximize your bowl. I like to stack proteins then veggies on top of each other in that order. Good eats and experience.
